Used for disabling a target's shields and short-circuiting their internal systems, including their engines. When used by the right pilot, it is capable of disabling anything from starfighters to small warships.

It is commonly found on the B-wings of the New Republic, but is able to be mounted to certain other fighters as well.
A popular starfighter-mounted warhead launcher developed by Krupx Munitions.\n\nIt can house light proton torpedoes, concussion missiles, or ion torpedoes, and is found on many fighters.

After reports by Imperial pilots regarding the inadequacies of the L-s1 laser cannons mounted on their TIE fighters, Sienar Fleet Systems developed the L-s7.2 as a replacement weapon.\n\nIt features several improvements over the older cannons, chief of which is its better coolant system. With a slower buildup of heat, TIE fighters produced since the Battle of Endor can fire for longer periods.

More destructive than the slightly older but more common L-s7.2 laser cannon, the L-s9.3 had the power to destroy small asteroids in one shot. Developed by Sienar Fleet Systems to provide additional firepower against shielded Rebel fighters, the L-s9.3 was most notably used as the primary armament of Darth Vader's prototype TIE/x1 fighter.\n\nHowever, it was also commonly found on other advanced and specialty TIEs. Some pilots dislike its three-round burst, but others prefer the high damage of individual bolts.

A Taim and Bak-produced dual heavy turbolaser turret, usually installed on warships as their main anti-capital weapons.\n\nIt boasts a high range for general ship-based weaponry, as well as decent damage and fire rate.

A Taim and Bak-produced dual-barreled heavy turbolaser turret that is similar to the XX-18, usually installed on warships as their main anti-capital weapons.\n\nIts high range and decent fire rate are offset by a relatively low damage.

The Borstel Galactic Defense-produced NK-7 ion cannon is a powerful ship-based weapon used on Imperial capital ships, especially Imperial Star Destroyers. Each emplacement has its own turbine generator and is controlled by gunnery stations inside the ship. It is quite effective at disabling the shields and engines of capital ships.\n\nA volley from these weapons can wreak havok on electrical systems and shield generators.
The Borstel Galactic Defense-produced NK-5 ion cannon is a powerful ion cannon used on Imperial capital ships. It features high fire rate, but relatively low shield disruption.
A heavier variant of the Krupx Warhead Launcher that can be fitted to medium-sized warships.\n\nIt is capable of carrying medium ion and proton torpedoes.
A general-purpose point defence light laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence. It has short range and low damage, leaving it unsuitable for larger targets.

A Clone War-era point defence laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence. Compared to the SL-1 point defense cannon, it has higher range, fire rate, and shield disruption, but lower damage to hulls.

A quad-barreled general-purpose laser turret manufactured by Rendili Hyperworks, installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence. It features a high range for quad laser cannons, but some captains may prefer a dual cannon turret with higher range to defend against hostile fighters.

The NK-3 ion cannon is a type of starfighter-scale ion cannon that is manufactured by Borstel Galactic Defense. Though it is ostensibly more powerful than other ion cannons, it overheats more quickly, fires more slowly, and has a shorter range.\n\nUsed for disabling the shields and engines of a target.
The T-s5 proton torpedo launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for use in various TIE craft. The launcher allows for the use of medium torpedoes and light cluster missiles.

The M-g-2 general-purpose warhead launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for use in several TIE-series starships. It allows ships to fire light missiles and torpedoes, and is distinguished from other launchers by its ability to store an extra missile.
Mining laser turrets are used to crack open large asteroids for the purpose of mining resources such as silicon.

The SW-7 ion cannon is a general-use ion cannon manufactured by ArMek. It is a powerful weapon found on heavy fighters, but its high damage is offset by its low firing rate.\n\nUsed for disabling the shields and engines of medium to heavy warships.
The SW-7-HOI ion cannon is a heavier version of SW-7 manufactured by ArMek, usually installed on Mon Calamari capital ships.\n\nUsed for disabling the shields and engines of medium to heavy warships.
The XV9 turbolaser is a shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation. It is typically found on Mon Calamari Cruisers of all sizes.

The RG-9 laser cannon is a model of laser cannon manufactured by Borstel Galactic Defense.Most commonly mounted on the New Republic's A-wings, it has a very high fire rate. However, it suffers from low damage output and a somewhat short range.
The MG9 proton torpedo launcher is manufactured by Krupx Munitions.\n\nCan only hold proton torpedoes.
The HM-6 Concussion Missile Launcher is a type of concussion missile launcher commonly found on the A-wing interceptor and other freelance fighters.

The SW-4 is a dual ion cannon manufactured by ArMek during the early years of the Galactic Empire. A notoriously delicate system, the cannon's internals tended to vibrate out of alignment during flight, leading to mechanics hating the weapon.\n\nIt is most commonly found on BTL-series Y-wing starfighters used by the Alliance to Restore the Republic, though few were ever operational.
The XV7 is a Taim and Bak-produced light dual-barreled turbolaser. It is effective at average ranges and possesses decent damage output.\n\nIt can be mounted on certain station modules.
The XV7's bigger cousin. Able to be mounted on medium-size warships, the XV8 is comparatively low range, slow-firing, but has an average damage and price.
A heavy turbolaser cannon commonly seen on the bows of Munificent-class Star Frigates.\n\nA powerful weapon that is held back somewhat by a relatively short range.

A heavy ion cannon commonly seen on the bows of Munificent-class Star Frigates.\n\nExcels at quickly disabling the shields and engines of a similarly-sized ship, but like its turbolaser counterpart, held back somewhat by a relatively short range.

The R-T0 is a twin laser cannon designed by ArMek that is commonly mounted as the aft turret of some shuttles and transports.\n\nIt is an effective anti-starfighter weapon, reasonably powerful for the size of the ships that use it.

A dual-barreled long range laser turret manufactured by Rendili Hyperworks, installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence. It has average range and firepower compared to other dual laser cannons.

The IX-4 is a laser cannon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation.\n\nDespite being older than the KX5, it is still a formidable starfighter-scale weapon, boasting respectable firepower and range, at the cost of a lower fire rate.

The IX-8 was an attempt by the Taim and Bak Corporation to improve and modernise the IX-4. However, its only improvement over the IX-4 ended up being its higher damage output, and it overheats faster despite its burst fire, leading the company to quickly discontinue the IX-8 in favour of developing and manufacturing the more modern KX-series of laser cannons.\n\nNevertheless, many spacers and factions seem to have found a use for it.

The Taim and Bak-produced MS-1 is infamous for being the primary armament of the Empire's All Terrain Armoured Transports, and many factions took to mounting it on starfighters due to its low cost and resistance to overheating. However, its damage output in dogfights is underwhelming and its burst fire can be unappealing to some spacers.

The MS-2b is manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation as the MS-1's bigger brother, now specifically designed for starfighters.\n\nIt has significantly improved damage output while still being resistant to overheating, though it retains the three-round burst of its predecessor.

The MS-3 is the third and final product in the MS-series of laser cannons manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation.It features a significantly longer range and higher damage output than the MS-2b, but far lower fire rate, even for its three-round burst.

Produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation, the KX20-B is a heavy laser cannon typically mounted on fast attack craft and corvettes.It has a respectable damage output but average range and slow firing speed.

The Taim and Bak-produced XV1 prow turbolaser is a powerful bow-mounted weapon that is commonly seen on corvettes such as the Defender-class and the more offensive-minded variants of the Gozanti-class cruiser.\n\nIt has a respectable range and damage, but is held back by its tendency to overheat quickly.

The GA-60s is a heavy laser cannon produced by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations.\n\nIt is relatively weak, and is further held back by a short range for its size, but thanks to advanced technology and cooling systems it seldom overheats during a pitched fight, and is excellent at wearing down a target's shields.

The KV22 heavy repeating laser cannon is manufactured by one of the many corporations that currently reside within the Corporate Sector. Despite its high damage and range, its low fire rate belies its nature as a repeating cannon.\n\nIt is slow to overheat, however, which makes it effective in sustained fire.

The HS-10 is a heavy laser cannon manufactured by the Independent Commerce Guild, and is used on medium-size ships fielded by Commerce Guild forces.\n\nCompared to similar heavy laser cannons, it boasts a high fire rate and range, but low damage and high heat.

A mass driver Chaingun is a ship-mounted weapon that launches solid projectiles at high speeds towards a target, typically by rapidly accelerating the projectile via electromagnetism as it leaves the cannon's barrel.

Some mass drivers, such as this one originally produced by MandalMotors, are fed projectiles via a magazine system, allowing the cannon to fire at a reasonably fast rate before the barrel needs to cool down.

Mass drivers are able to seriously damage a starship's hull because of their nature as projectile weapons.

The XX3 prow turbolaser is produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation exclusively for the Empire.\n\nWhile similar to the XV1, it has a slightly longer range and higher fire rate, leading to more damage overall.

The E-X is a heavy blaster cannon found on anti-personnel vehicles and small, cheap fighters. Due to high heat buildup, short range, and low damage, it is not a weapon actively sought out by pilots with any choice.
A missile rack allows for the mounting of additional missiles on a starship. Typically this is only done on tiny frames with precious little internal space, like droid fighters.
A modernised version of DBY-24 medium turbolaser.\n\nCan only be mounted in the lateral trenches of Venator Star Destroyers.

The A-2 ion cannon, manufactured by ArMek, is designed for small fighters. Ion cannons are capable of disabling the shields and engines of other small fighters, but not very useful beyond that role.\n\nThough the A-2 cannon boasts high shield disruption, its very slow fire rate and three-round burst leave it best suited to hit-and-run strikes.

Dual-barreled general-purpose long-range laser turret manufactured by Rendili Hyperworks, installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence. It has the highest range and hull damage of any laser cannon, but is limited in production.

The Lancer quad flak turret represents the pinnacle of small formfactor anti-starfighter defense technology.\n\nThis corvette-scale weapon system fires proximity-fused shells that detonate near hostile craft, creating devastating shrapnel clouds capable of shredding even shielded fighters.

The OPD-LB is a corvette-scale dual-barreled turbolaser based on the successful OPD Dual Laser turret. This design features longer barrels and greatly expanded power delivery systems for use against larger vessels.\n\nBoasting decent damage output with an above average range and high fire rate, this turret can also be installed on select station modules as a defence weapon.

The XI5 is a corvette-scale dual-barreled turbolaser turret manufactured MandalMotors derived from the popular XX2 Light Turbolaser produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation.\n\nFeaturing decent damage output with an above average range and high fire rate, this dual turbolaser can be also be installed on select station modules as a defence weapon.

A general-purpose light laser turret installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence. The distinctive blue bolts, harkening to the Republic Navy's weaponry in the Clone Wars, is more disruptive to shielding than it is to hulls, compromising between traditional laser cannons and ion cannons.

General-purpose quad laser turret installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence. Though it has a very low fire rate compared to other quad cannons, its high damage and increased range help keep it competitive in combat. The QR-BB's distinctive blue bolts, like other Clone War-era weapons, are more disruptive to shielding than other gas mixes, though not as much as specialised ion cannons.
NOT YET IMPLEMENTED\n\nThe X18 is a single-barreled heavy turbolaser turret that boasts both a decent damage output and a respectable range for its size.

The KK-22 is manufactured by BlasTech Industries and is offered by the New Republic and loyalist systems, though rarely used by their warships.\n\nThough it has a rather high damage for its size, its low range and slow fire rate may turn warship captains to seek other options.

Manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation, the XX-20 is commonly found on Imperial-class Star Destroyers\n\nIt features a high damage and modest fire rate, but a low range for weapons of its class.

The KDD300 is manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations, and is commonly found installed on heavy warships. Its high fire rate allows it to compete in firepower with quad heavy turbolasers.

The TM8 is a quad-barreled heavy turbolaser produced by the Commerce Guild, and is commonly found installed on ships used by their forces.\n\nBoasts a high damage output and a decent range, though its range falls short of dual heavy turbolasers.

The DBY-827 is a heavy dual-barreled turbolaser manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation.\n\nMade famous for its use aboard Venator-class Star Destroyers during the Clone Wars, its high fire rate and modest range ensured that it would remain a common sight throughout the galaxy years after the Clone Wars' conclusion.
The V-50 dual-barreled turret is a long range ion cannon usually mounted on capital ships. It significantly disrupts shields and ship engines, but fires extremely slowly.

An upscaled variant of the V-50 manufactured exclusively for the Empire.\n\nThough it boasts a high range and fire rate, its shield disruption is relatively low, its turn rate is lower, and its bolts travel slower
The SW10-2 is a heavy dual-barreled ion cannon manufactured by ArMek and commonly used by the New Republic.\n\nIts relatively high fire rate and range make up for its low shield disruption.

The A-4 Ion Cannon is manufactured by ArMek industries and is best suited for disabling the shields and engines of medium-size capital ships.\n\nCompared to other ion cannons of its size, the A-4 boasts modest damage, but a relatively short range.

The MM-1 is a medium ion cannon manufactured by one of the many corporations that currently reside within the Corporate Sector. Boasting an exceptionally long range for its size, it is used to disable the shields and engines of medium-size capital ships.
The XI7 is a medium turbolaser manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation, featuring a decent damage output and average range and fire rate for a weapon if its type.
The HX1 is manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation and used almost exclusively by the New Republic.\n\nIt boasts a high damage output and a decent range.
The D6 is a medium dual-barreled turbolaser manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations\n\nIt boasts a high damage output for its size, but only an average range and low fire rate.
Modernised variant of the HX1 produced exclusively for Imperial use.\n\nThough its range is slightly higher, its damage suffers slightly.
Medium dual-barreled turbolaser manufactured by the Commerce Guild.\n\nIt has decent damage output coupled with long range for its size, but a very low firing rate.

The Clone Wars-era counterpart to the more modern DBY-44.

Boasts better shield damage and range than its successors, but suffers from slightlylower hull damage.

Can only be mounted in the lateral trenches of Venator-class Star Destroyers.

A dual-barreled heavy turbolaser initially manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards, but now available throughout the galaxy.\n\nIt has significantly higher damage per bolt than other dual heavy turbolasers, as well as the highest range, suffers from an extremely low fire rate.
A quad-barreled medium turbolaser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards.\n\nIts high damage output that is held back by a relatively short range and slow fire rate.
A MandalMotors reverse-engineering of the common Imperial HX4 Quad Turbolaser.\n\nFeatures high rotation speed and per shot damage, with a slow fire rate.

Medium dual-barreled rapid-fire turbolaser that is widely manufactured across the galaxy. Though it suffers from a short range and low damage, its high fire rate allows it to compete with other dual medium turbolasers.

A flak turret manufactured by numerous corporations and commonly found on heavy capital ships across the galaxy.\n\nFires proximity-fused shells, providing effective area denial against starfighter formations.

A rapid-fire laser cannon that is commonly seen on heavy fighters or patrol craft such as the Firespray-31. Though each shot has relatively low damage, their explosive nature and extremely high fire rate can shred fighters and freighters.
A Clone Wars-era weapon installed on Republic fighters.\n\nIt has a high fire rate and above average shield damage, but reduced range.
A Clone Wars-era weapon installed on heavy Republic fighters.\n\nIt has a moderate fire rate and high shield damage, but reduced range.
A Clone Wars-era weapon typically found on Republic gunships\n\nThough equally damaging to shields and hull, this damage is only average.

A more modern version of the Clone Wars-era DBY-24 dual-barreled turbolaser, now able to be mounted on many heavy capital ships.\n\nLike all Galactic Republic-era weapons now produced by the Kaminoans, it deals more damage to shields at the cost of hull damage.
The D10 is a long-range medium single-barreled turbolaser manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations,\n\nIt has the longest range for its weapon class on the market.
The D8 is a medium single-barreled turbolaser manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations.\n\nIt boasts a high damage output, but slow firing rate.
Turbolaser manufactured by Mandal Motors. In contrast to other models available on market, the MoH-2 has a higher fire rate and range but lower per-projectile damage.

The Mandalorians have improved mass driver technology to allow their ships to fire dense metallic slugs with high speed and accuracy.\n\nA unique weapon due to its ability to partially bypass shields, it can be very dangerous to ships with fragile frames.

An ion cannon manufactured by MandalMotors.\n\nDue to unique power generation requirements, it is usually not compatible with non-MandalMotors ships, which makes such ships challenging to outfit in other sectors of the galaxy.
A single-barrel medium turbolaser designed to be installed on slow fire support platforms, such as Dreadnought Heavy Cruisers.\n\nIt is average in firepower, range, and fire rate.

The XX2 is a Taim and Bak-produced light dual-barreled turbolaser specifically for Imperial corvettes.

It is effective at relatively short ranges and possesses decent damage output.

It can also be mounted to certain station modules.
The QF4 is a light quad-barreled turbolaser used as an anti-corvette weapon on Imperial medium warships.

The DB-6 is a light dual-barreled turbolaser used by the Republic during the Clone Wars.
It suffers from relatively short range and low fire rate, but high shield damage.

Though it is rarely used by the wider galaxy anymore, it can still be mounted to many starships and select station modules.
A triple-barreled heavy turbolaser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards.\n\nDesigned for long range suppressive bombardment of enemy capital ships.
H-15 is a turbolaser designed by CEC for use on its medium-sized corvettes.\n\nDesigned to to quickly break through armour when a target's shields are down.
Heavy laser turret developed by CEC and installed on medium starships for anti-starfighter defence.
Heavy remote laser turret developed by CEC and installed on medium starships for anti-starfighter defence.
A light laser turret developed for and installed on fighters.
A Clone-era single-barrel medium turbolaser. Like other Republic weapons of the era, it deals more damage to shields than ship hulls, but boasts a very high fire rate for a weapon of its class.

Heavy laser cannons designed to overwhelm heavy Rebel fighters due to its superior range and punch.\n\nWhen the Galactic Empire struggled to fit the H-s9.3 cannon to standard TIE/ln fighters, Sienar Fleet Systems elected to create a new TIE with an outrigger pod to to carry the weapon.

The V-100 heavy ion cannon is a capital-scale ion weapon mounted to massive ships such as the Home One-type Mon Calamari cruiser. It is used for disabling the shields and engines of other capital ships.\n\nHowever, it has a slow firing rate and relatively short range best suited to close brawls with other capital ships.

The MZ-22 is a rapid-fire laser cannon manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation, representing their latest development in starfighter weaponry. As the name suggests, it has a very high rate of fire, but relatively low damage.
A dual-barreled short range laser turret with low damage and increased projectile speed.\n\nIt can commonly be found on starships and stations as anti-fighter defence.
A quad-barreled short range laser turret with increased projectile speed\n\nIt can commonly be found on starships and stations as anti-fighter defence.
Yuuzhan-Vong weapon system based on bioplasma technology.
Yuuzhan-Vong weapon system based on bioplasma technology.

The ARX heavy laser cannon was designed by Incom Corporation specifically for Arc-170 starfighter. Combining a high rate of fire and considerable damage for a continuous-fire weapon, they were key to success of the starfighter.
The DCL twin laser turret is an old design intended for use on the Dynamic-class freighter.
A heavy turbolaser cannon specifically designed for Recusant Destroyer.

The AM Heavy Laser Cannon is an attempt by MandalMotors to create a powerful anti-fighter laser cannon for medium sized gunboats. Its high fire rate more than makes up for a relatively low damage and range.
A twin tail cannon developed by MandalMotors. It is commonly mounted on the rear of Gauntlet fighter/transports, but can also be equipped on other ships with similar defensive armament.

The KDD2055 is manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations, and is commonly found installed on defence platforms and space stations.\n\nThough it fires rapidly compared to other weapons of its class, its power output and range are low.

A station battery that is commonly found installed on defence platforms and space stations.\n\nThough it fires slowly compared to other station batteries, it boasts a modest range and packs a major punch.

A station battery that is commonly found installed on defence platforms and space stations.\n\nThough it boasts high damage and a substantial range, it cannot fire very quickly compared to other batteries of its class.
A Clone-era station battery that is commonly found installed on defence platforms and space stations.\n\nIts high fire rate is offset by its relatively low range.
A Mass Driver station battery that is commonly found installed on the space stations of pirates and Mandalorians.\n\nIts high velocity projectiles can penetrate shields at high range.
A moderately powerful laser cannon designed by Taim Corporation, usually installed on light fighters.\n\nIt has a very high fire rate, but low damage.

A rapid-fire space-superiority quad laser cannon designed by Taim Corporation, its lacklustre range is overshadowed by immense fire rate.\n\nWhen used on fast interceptors, it can shred enemy targets.
The MoH-88 is a unique Mandalorian design of heavy long-range turbolaser that was installed on the ancient Kandosii Dreadnaught.

A dual medium turbolaser unique to Hapan capital ships. While it has somewhat longer engagement range, it suffers from old turbolaser technology that the Hapes Consortium has used for centuries.\n\nIts damage potential is limited compared to other faction weaponry.

An ion cannon manufactured by the Hapes Consortium.\n\nDue to unique power generation requirements, it is usually not compatible with non-Hapan ships, which makes such ships difficult to outfit in other sectors of the galaxy.
Hapan Turbolaser Cannon usually seen on Hapan Nova Battlecruiser.
A unique Ion Cannon usually seen on Hapan Nova Battlecruiser.
Ion Cannon usually mounted on large warships.

The PD Quad Turbolaser is an Imperial-designed point defence weapon system that prioritizes accuracy and fire rate over raw destructive power. Manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards, this quad-barreled turbolaser was specifically engineered to counter the increasing threat of Rebel starfighter attacks on Imperial capital ships.

By sacrificing per-shot damage for enhanced targeting systems and a higher rate of fire, the PD Quad provides effective coverage against fast-moving targets that would otherwise evade heavier turbolaser batteries. Its reduced power requirements also allow for installation on vessels where power distribution is a concern.

Commonly found on the Executor Super Star Destroyer and other Imperial vessels, the PD Quad has proven itself an essential component of layered defensive systems.

A quad-barreled heavy turbolaser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards, configured for medium-range engagements and constant fire rate.\n\nThis model uses a standard turret cap that fits on top or bottom of a ship's hull.

A quad-barreled heavy turbolaser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards, configured for long-range engagements and constant fire rate.\n\nThis model is mounted in a ball turret that fits within the trenches of large battlecruisers and dreadnaughts.
These heavy turbolaser turrets are specifically designed for extremely long-range engagements, and are usually mounted on planetary installations or dreadnaught-size vessels.

Heavy turbolaser turrets used on Bellator-class battlecruisers, specifically designed for long-range engagements with low power requirements.\n\nWhile their damage potential per shot is lower than that of comparable weapon systems, they provide a constant barrage of fire on distant targets, making it harder for the target to recover shields and evade.

The HKD heavy turbolaser is a dual-barrel capital ship weapon system developed by Hoersch-Kessel Drive, Inc. during the Clone Wars era. Designed for long-range ship-to-ship engagements, this turbolaser represents HKD's extensive experience in capital ship engineering.\n\nOriginally commissioned by the Confederacy of Independent Systems to counter Republic capital ship formations, the HKD heavy turbolaser combines sustained fire capability with competent range, making it ideal for standoff bombardment tactics favored by Separatist fleet commanders.
A medium turbolaser turret usually used on Sith ships.
This massive broadside ion cannon is fitted exclusively to the Subjugator-class Battlecruiser, and is capable of damaging and disabling even the strongest shield generators
This massive ion turret is fitted exclusively to the Subjugator-class Battlecruiser, and is capable of damaging and disabling even the strongest shield generators

A dual heavy turbolaser system developed by Hoersch-Kessel Drive, Inc. during the Clone Wars era. Drawing on their expertise in capital ship engineering, HKD created this weapon to provide consistent, long-range firepower for their larger vessel designs.\n\nThe dual-barrel configuration allows for sustained fire rates while maintaining the thermal management necessary for prolonged engagements.

An evolution of HKD's dual heavy turbolaser design, this quad-barreled system represents Hoersch-Kessel Drive's commitment to firepower superiority. Originally commissioned by Separatist naval strategists during the Clone Wars, the quad configuration provides devastating volleys capable of overwhelming shield generators on Republic capital ships.\n\nThe four synchronized barrels allow for both sustained bombardment and concentrated alpha strikes, making it a versatile weapon for various tactical situations.

The pinnacle of Hoersch-Kessel Drive's turbolaser development, this super heavy weapon system represents decades of capital ship armament expertise. Originally conceived during the late Clone Wars period to counter Republic capital ship formations, the design was shelved when the Separatist leadership deemed it too resource-intensive.\n\nYears later, the Independent Commerce Guild commissioned HKD to revive and complete the project, resulting in a devastating weapon platform capable of sustained long-range bombardment against even the most heavily shielded targets.
A medium range turbolaser manufactured by Rendili Hyperworks, commonly installed on Hammerhead-class Cruisers and other light destroyers.
A corvette-scale concussion missile launcher. Holds medium-sized payloads.
A concussion missile launcher designed for medium and large capital ships. Holds large payloads.
An array of multiple missile tubes.
A corvette-scale proton torpedo launcher.\n\nHolds medium-sized payloads.
A proton torpedo launcher designed for medium and large capital ships.\n\nHolds large payloads.
The Flex Tube proton torpedo launcher is a proton torpedo launcher manufactured by Arakyd Industries. It is typically mounted to heavy fighters and bombers, and carries medium missiles and torpedoes.
Starfighter-scale concussion missile launchers are produced by a variety of manufacturers.\n\nThese typically carry light missiles.

The Phylon Q7 tractor beam projector is a high-performance gravitational restraint system manufactured by Phylon Transport, a corporation that has built its reputation on producing some of the most reliable and powerful tractor beam technology in the galaxy.\n\nMost famous for its use aboard Imperial-class Star Destroyers, these projectors are able to hold all but the heaviest capital ships in place, and can be fitted to other similarly-sized warships as well.

The Phylon Q7 tractor beam projector is a high-performance gravitational restraint system manufactured by Phylon Transport, a corporation that has built its reputation on producing some of the most reliable and powerful tractor beam technology in the galaxy.\n\nThis variant is usually installed on Cantwell-class Arrestor Cruisers and is widely regarded as the strongest tractor beam generator in the galaxy.
The Phylon Q5 tractor beam projector is produced by Phylon Transport and is essentially a smaller, less capable version of the Q7, designed to be mounted on medium-size warships.
The Phylon Q3 projector is a low-power tractor beam installed on small spacecraft to help them move cargo around or slow down their target.
A launching apparatus that launches seismic charges. Best fitted to the back of a starship in case of a hot pursuit.

A gravity well projector is a powerful device affixed to an interdictor vessel used to pull ships out of hyperspace. As a ship could not usually enter hyperspace when within a planet's gravitational pull, the gravity well projector mimicked the effect by creating a strong artificial gravity well known as an interdiction field.
The M-F-1 Concussion warhead launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems.

The proton bomb launcher is a widely-adopted weapon system used throughout the galaxy to deploy unguided proton bombs. Due to its simple mechanical design and reliable performance, this launcher has become standard equipment across many military organizations.\n\nFrom the Imperial Navy's bomber squadrons to Rebel Alliance strike craft, from Corporate Sector security forces to independent freight haulers seeking self-defense capabilities, the proton bomb launcher's versatility and ease of maintenance have made it ubiquitous.
System designed to launch MS-15 Diamond-Boron Cruise Missiles.

The EP-750X EMP missile launcher is a type of missile launcher produced by Merr-Sonn Munitions, Inc., they fire guided missiles that were tipped with EMP warheads that delivered a powerful ion blast upon detonation.\n\nEffective against massed droid formations, as well as against capital ships and weapon emplacements.
Designed by Mandal Hypernautics, this launcher fires some of the largest ordnance currently seen in the galaxy.\n\nIt is most often seen on modernized ancient Mandalorian designs.
This launcher is used with light unguided rockets.
This launcher is used with medium unguided rockets.

A concussion missile is one of the most commonplace projectile weapons in the galaxy. Although they are not as destructive as proton torpedoes, concussion missiles are still capable of beating down and piercing a target's shields.\n\nThe ST2 is a starfighter-scale concussion missile produced by Arakyd Industries that is best used against other starfighters.

A small booster rod that deploys a cylindrical cluster of several downscaled ST2 concussion missiles attached to its center shortly after being launched from a starfighter.

Best used when engaging multiple starfighters.

ST2c Cluster Concussion Missiles fire in volleys of 7 for each ammunition consumed.

A concussion missile is one of the most commonplace projectile weapons in the galaxy. The ST3 is a corvette-scale concussion missile produced by Arakyd Industries.

Although they are not as destructive as proton torpedoes, concussion missiles are still capable of beating down and depleting a target's shields.

Best used against other corvettes.

A concussion missile is one of the most commonplace projectile weapons in the galaxy. The ST4 is a capital-scale concussion missile produced by Arakyd Industries.

Although they are not as destructive as proton torpedoes, concussion missiles are still capable of beating down and depleting a target's shields.

Best used against other large capital ships.

A large booster rod that deploys a cylindrical cluster of several downscaled ST4 concussion missiles attached to its center shortly after being launched from a capital ship.

Best used when engaging multiple large capital ships.

ST4c Heavy Concussion Missiles fire in volleys of 10 for each ammunition consumed.

A proton torpedo is a compact but highly destructive nuclear missile, able to essentially burn right through a target's shields and cause significant damage to its hull. The MG7-A is a starfighter-scale proton torpedo produced by Krupx Munitions.\n\nThese torpedoes are generally used against both starfighters and larger warships.

A proton torpedo is a compact but highly destructive nuclear missile, able to essentially burn right through a target's shields and cause significant damage to its hull. The MG4-A is a corvette-scale proton torpedo produced by Krupx Munitions.\n\nThese torpedoes are generally used against both starfighters and larger warships.

A proton torpedo is a compact but highly destructive nuclear missile, able to essentially burn right through a target's shields and cause significant damage to its hull. The MG1-A is a capital-scale proton torpedo produced by Krupx Munitions.\n\nThese torpedoes are generally used against both starfighters and larger warships.

An ion torpedo is a missile that, as the name suggests, carries an intense ion charge, and is capable of disabling a craft's shields and even temporarily crippling its subsystems, including its engines. The 10-IMs is a starfighter-scale ion torpedo produced by Merr-Sonn Munitions, Incorporated.\n\nGenerally, these torpedoes are effective against both starfighters and larger warships.

An ion torpedo is a missile that, as the name suggests, carries an intense ion charge, and is capable of disabling a craft's shields and even temporarily crippling its subsystems, including its engines. The 10-IMm is a corvette-scale ion torpedo produced by Merr-Sonn Munitions, Incorporated.\n\nGenerally, these torpedoes are effective against both starfighters and larger warships.

A rocket, also known as a dumbfire missile, is a concussion missile that has no internal guidance systems, and travels in a straight line when launched from a starship. Their key advantage over conventional concussion missiles is that several can be fired in rapid succession.

Rockets are incredibly basic weapons, with a typical rocket's method of propulsion being a chemical explosion that is then forced out of its nozzle, and can be traced all the way back to antiquity. This also makes them extremely easy to manufacture, and as such they can be found all across the galaxy, most often sold in bulk.

Light Rockets fire in volleys of 3 for each ammunition consumed.

A rocket, also known as a dumbfire missile, is a concussion missile that has no internal guidance systems, and travels in a straight line when launched from a starship. Their key advantage over conventional concussion missiles is that several can be fired in rapid succession.

Rockets are incredibly basic weapons, with a typical rocket's method of propulsion being a chemical explosion that is then forced out of its nozzle, and can be traced all the way back to antiquity. This also makes them extremely easy to manufacture, and as such they can be found all across the galaxy, most often sold in bulk.

Medium Rockets fire in volleys of 3 for each ammunition consumed.

A carbonite missile is a missile that, on impact, freezes a section of a starship's hull in carbonite, causing it to become brittle.

Deals damage over time.

Sold at equipment docks or wharfs belonging to a Mandalorian faction.

A discord missile, nicknamed the Blue Streak for its blue exhaust trail, is a missile whose payload is seven Pistoeka sabotage droids; when deployed from the missile, these droids attach themselves to, and can wreak havoc on, a starship's hull, doing considerable amounts of damage over time.

Interestingly, the discord missile seems to have exceptionally intelligent internal guidance systems, as the missile uses external manoeuvring thrusters to "steer" itself out of the way of incoming enemy point-defence fire, and can outmanoeuvre most starfighters.

Sold at wharfs or equipment docks belonging to the Techno Union or Independent Commerce Guild.

A diamond-boron missile is a missile protected by armour plating composed of a diamond-boron compound. This armour, while incredibly expensive, is able to harmlessly deflect starfighter-scale blaster fire.\n\nThis cruise missile can inflict extreme amounts of damage at long range.

These Proton Bombs are short-range, unguided explosives fired in a wide scatter. Their shield penetration makes them as effective against capital ships as stations.\n\nProton Bombs fire in volleys of 5 for each ammunition consumed.
Missile used in EP-750X EMP missile launcher.

The ST8 is a super heavy capital-scale concussion missile produced by Mandal Hypernautics.

Although they are not as destructive as proton torpedoes, concussion missiles are still capable of beating down and depleting a target's shields.

Commonly fitted to Mandalorian warships such as the Kandosii-class dreadnaught and other moderized ancient Mandalorian designs, these missiles are designed for maximum destructive impact against slow heavily armored capital ships.

A seismic charge, also known as a sonic mine, is a bomb that when deployed by a starship is able to destroy or seriously damage anything caught in its destructive shockwave. The Void-7 is produced by Krupx Munitions and can only be launched by a starship that can mount a dedicated seismic charge launching apparatus, such as the Firespray-31.
On explosion will decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S and M ships, effect on L and XL ships is limited.
On explosion will severely decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S and M ships. L and XL ships suffer moderate effect.
On hit will decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S ships, M ships are effected less, has no effect on larger ships.
On hit will decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S and M ships, has limited effect on L and XL ships.
On hit will severely decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S and M ships, also affects L and XL ships.
Will stop in place almost any type of target.
Will slowdown any target, effect on large ships is weaker.
Will slowdown S and M ships, has no effect on larger ships.
Will slowdown S, has no effect on larger ships.
On explosion will attach Buzz Droids to any nearby ship, dealing hull damage and impacting ship manoeuvrability.
When targeting enemies will create a bubble of gravity anomaly stopping all affected ships from using travel drive.
The P-12 is a starfighter-scale shield generator manufactured by Sirplex. It is the second weakest shield generator of its class but also one of the most popular, and it regenerates the fastest.
Shield generator manufactured by Novaldex for advanced TIE models and other light starfighters.
Shield generator manufactured by Novaldex for advanced TIE models and other light starfighters.
The Q2 is a starfighter-scale shield generator manufactured by Quintad Orbital Manufacturing, an arms and ship manufacturing firm sponsored by the Quintad of Eriadu.
Starfighter-scale shield generator manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation.

Starfighter-scale shield generator produced by Sienar Fleet Systems. As the Empire began to fracture after the Battle of Endor, SFS decided to begin production of basic shield generators for the TIE/LN, TIE/sa and TIE/IN to improve their survivability. After moving to a wider market, many other old fighters, previously unshielded, were retrofitted to mount this type of shield generator.
Shield generator manufactured by Novaldex for advanced TIE models and other light starfighters.
Starfighter-scale shield generator manufactured by Sirplex.
Starfighter-scale shield generator manufactured by Sirplex.
The Q2 is a starfighter-scale shield generator manufactured by Quintad Orbital Manufacturing, an arms and ship manufacturing firm sponsored by the Quintad of Eriadu.
Starfighter-scale shield generator manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation.
A model of astromech manufactured by Industrial Automation and heavily used by the Corporate Sector Authority.\n\nProvides a 50% boost to shield strength and regeneration.
A model of astromech manufactured by Industrial Automation.\n\nProvides a 40% boost to shield strength and regeneration.
A model of astromech manufactured by Industrial Automation.\n\nProvides a 30% boost to shield strength and regeneration.
A model of astromech manufactured by Industrial Automation and heavily used by the Alliance to Restore the Republic.\n\nProvides a 40% boost to shield strength and regeneration speed.

A droid manufactured by LesTech in an attempt to take advantage of the lucrative astromech market. It is notable for having a boxy chassis and using a single, wide tread track.\n\nProvides only a marginal boost to shield strength, but a 70% boost to regeneration speed.

Corvette-scale shield generator manufactured by Novaldex.

Acts as a redundancy stored inside a ship and is not visible on its hull.

NOT SUITABLE FOR STATIONS.
Corvette-scale shield generator manufactured by Novaldex.\n\nThis model is mounted to the exterior of ships and stations, and may be vulnerable to attack.

Corvette-scale shield generator manufactured by Quintad Orbital Manufacturing\n\nThis model is mounted to the exterior of ships and stations, and may be vulnerable to attack.

NOT SUITABLE FOR STATIONS.
Corvette-scale shield generator manufactured by MandalMotors.\n\nThis model is mounted to the exterior of ships and stations, and may be vulnerable to attack.
Frigate-scale shield generator manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation.
Frigate-scale shield generator manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards.\n\nOften found installed on large Imperial transports, frigates and logistics vessels.
Frigate-scale shield generator manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation.
Frigate-scale shield generator manufactured by Quintad Orbital Manufacturing.
Frigate-scale shield generator manufactured by Phoah-Kingsmeyer.

Cruiser-scale shield generator manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards.
