Cruiser-scale shield generator manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards.\n\nOften found installed on large Imperial transports, cruisers, and logistics vessels.
Cruiser-scale shield generator manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation.
Cruiser-scale shield generator manufactured by Mon Calamari Shipyards.
Cruiser-scale shield generator manufactured by Quintad Orbital Manufacturing.
Cruiser-scale shield generator manufactured by Phoah-Kingsmeyer.
Cruiser-scale shield generator manufactured by Phoah-Kingsmeyer.
Capital-scale shield generator manufactured by Argon-Faryeladi, a starship equipment manufacturing corporation headquartered just outside the Unknown Regions.
Capital-scale shield generator manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation
Capital-scale shield generator manufactured by Mon Calamari Shipyards.

Capital-scale shield generator manufactured by Quintad Orbital Manufacturing.\n\nDespite its somewhat redundant marketing name, the BlueField is still a decently effective shield projector for its size.
Capital-scale shield generator manufactured by MandalMotors
Capital-scale shield generator manufactured by Phoah-Kingsmeyer.
Battlecruiser-scale shield generator manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation, for use aboard the largest capital ships.
Battlecruiser-scale shield generator manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation, for use aboard the largest capital ships.
The ISD-72x is a local-area deflector shield generator and sensor array produced by Kuat Drive Yards and is commonly installed on Imperial I-class Star Destroyers.

The ISD-73x is a local-area deflector shield generator and sensor array produced by Kuat Drive Yards and is commonly installed on Imperial II-class Star Destroyers.\n\nMore powerful than the ISD-72x, it also has stronger armour plating, giving it considerably more protection against snubfighter attacks.

Thermal shields are heavily reinforced deflector shields that has very high capacity but lower regeneration speed. The DEC-78 is a thermal shield generator manufactured by the Dac Engineering Corporation, a Dac-based manufacturing corporation run by former Quarren separatists.

The ISD-54x is a local-area shield generator and sensor array produced by Kuat Drive Yards.\n\nIt is a downscaled version of the ISD-72x, meant to be installed on smaller Star Destroyers such as the Victory- and Procursator-class.
A shield generator component produced by Quintad Orbital Manufacturing that reinforces a starship's shields.

GNK power droids are effectively mobile power generators, with simple artificial intelligence for understanding basic commands.\n\nDue to their relatively high power output, they are capable of providing more power to a starship's shields.
The PSD-70x is a local-area deflector shield generator and sensor array produced by Kuat Drive Yards and is commonly installed on Procursator-class Star Destroyers.
Shield specifically designed for installation on largest of Mon Calamari dreadnaughts.
Shield specifically designed for installation on largest of Mon Calamari dreadnaughts.
This massive shield generator was originally designed by Kuat Drive Yards for use on their space stations.
Rendili StarDrive designed this extremely large shield generator to protect external elements on space stations.
An even smaller frigate-scale shield generator manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards. Often found installed on large Imperial transports, frigates and logistics vessels.
SFS P-s4 Twin Ion Engine with Hyperdrive
The SFS P-s4 twin ion engine is an ion drive system manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems and most notably used on TIE-series starfighters.
This is a modification with a hyperdrive. The SFS P-s4 twin ion engine was an ion drive system manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems and most notably used aboard the TIE-line starfighters.
The Ter58 ion turbine engine was a type of ion drive manufactured by Girodyne. The Corellian Engineering Corporation had them installed in their CR90 corvettes.
The SRB42 sublight engine was a sublight ion drive manufactured by Girodyne. It notably equipped the YT-1300 light freighter in a long strip known as a "wide bar engine".
The J-77 "Event Horizon" engine was a small yet powerful sublight drive unit that was manufactured by Novaldex, and used in the Rebel Alliance's RZ-1 A-wing interceptor.
The 2a fission engine or 2a Ion fission engine is manufactured by Incom Corporation and used by a wide variety of governments and private customers.
4L4 fusial thrust engines are advanced sublight drive engines manufactured by Incom Corporation for use aboard X-wing starfighters.
4L5 fusial thrust engines are advanced sublight drive engines manufactured by Incom Corporation for use aboard new models of X-wing starfighters.
The R200 ion jet engine, also known as R200 ion fission engine, was an ion engine produced by Koensayr Manufacturing, and was installed aboard their BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bomber.
The Destroyer-I ion engine is a model of ion engine manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards for use in the Imperial-class Star Destroyers in service of the Galactic Empire.
The Venator-I ion engine is a model of ion engine manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards for use in the Venator-class Star Destroyers.
SFS-204 sublight ion engines are a type of ion drive made by Sienar Fleet Systems. They can be found on Lambda-class T-4a shuttles.
The 4a fission engine is a heavier version of 2a engine, designed for medium-sized fighters and landing craft.
Engine for the Storm Commando Carrier.
Engine for the Jehavey'ir-type Assault Ship.
Engine for the Administrator-class Support Carrier.
Engine for the Eta-class Supply Barge.

The Hapans are a secretive, matriarchal society from the Hapes Cluster, a star systems region hidden behind dense nebulae.\n\nRenowned for their striking beauty, advanced technology, and political intrigue, they value isolationism and pride but often clash with the galaxy's broader powers.

The Mandalorians are a warrior culture from the Outer Rim, known for their highly advanced armour, unyielding combat skills, and a code centered around honour and survival\n\nThough their society has fractured over time, Mandalorian traditions and their iconic beskar armour remain symbols of resilience and strength.

The Sith are a faction rooted in the pursuit of power and domination, guided by the philosophy of the Dark Side of the Force.\n\nThey are known for their mastery of manipulation, advanced technology, and the construction of vast empires built on fear and control. Once almost eradicated, now rising to power again.

With the purchase of this licence, the holder gains the ability to view all trade offers on stations belonging to the issuing faction, regardless of whether those stations are already known at the time of purchase or discovered later.\n\nIf the licence holder's reputation with the issuing faction falls below the holding threshold, this licence and its effects will be forfeit.

The issuing faction for this licence is a Police Authority. The issuer holds this authority over its own space, and in certain cases over space owned by other factions.

In areas for which the issuing faction has authority, pilots in possession of this licence may freely scan ships in the issuing faction's name, and will also receive an increased reward when destroying enemies in the vicinity of stations that are friendly to, or owned by, the issuing faction.

If the pilot's reputation with the issuing faction falls below the holding threshold, this licence and its effects will be forfeit.

The holder of this license gains the ability to purchase modules that produce wares considered illegal by many factions, like Hutt Spice and Contraband Alcohol.\n\nIf the licence holder's reputation with the issuing faction falls below the holding threshold, this licence and its effects will be forfeit.

The Galactic Empire, also known as the New Order, or simply the Empire, was the galactic government that replaced the Galactic Republic in the aftermath of the Clone Wars. The Empire ushered galactic civilisation into a new age of safety, freedom, justice, and security, but this was achieved through absolute tyranny. Shortly before the Battle of Yavin, less than twenty years after its founding, the Empire had its legislative body, the Galactic Senate, dissolved, effectively becoming a military dictatorship.

It is currently the largest political, territorial, and military power to date, with access to nearly unlimited funding and holding sway over a large majority of the galaxy. However, following the death of its Emperor, Sheev Palpatine, during the disastrous Battle of Endor, the Empire has entered a period of steady decline over the past few years, with some political or military groups within the Empire breaking away entirely, either to continue the Imperial dream on their own terms or to form new dominions. Those still loyal to the Imperial leadership are known by Alliance intelligence officers as simply Imperial Loyalists.

As of 4 ABY, the Empire is lead by a Grand Vizier, originally a title held by the Emperor's personal assistant. The current Grand Vizier is Sate Pestage.

The Bounty Hunters' Guild, also known as the Bondsman's Guild, or simply the Bounty Guild, is an institution that regulates the complicated profession that is the bounty-hunting trade throughout the galaxy. Ensuring the legality of hunting for its members, it works alongside galactic governments and curates bounties for its members.\n\nAlthough it is smaller than it once was following a violent period of internal strife ignited by Boba Fett in 1 ABY, the Guild is still active today.
Bounty Hunters' Guild Unique Ship Access
Bounty Hunters' Guild Unique Equipment Access

The New Republic is the galactic government established by the Alliance to Restore the Republic to replace the Galactic Empire after the Battle of Endor. Like its predecessor, it was often simply referred to as the Republic. It has become the supreme governmental authority of the galaxy.\n\nThe "New" Republic is a continuation of the original Galactic Republic that had become known as the Old Republic. While the New Republic is busy establishing security around the galaxy, its adversaries are not yet done with the fight.

Remnants of the Alliance to Restore the Republic, now fulfilling police and special forces roles within the New Republic military.\n\nWhile diplomatically aligned with the New Republic and completely beholden to it economically, the Rebel Alliance does not always agree its methods and has been known to strike on its own against targets of opportunity.

Following the death of the Emperor at Endor, Imperial leadership fragmented into various warlords and renegade admirals, generals, and Moffs. Though many have given their loyalty to Grand Vizier Sate Pestage, leading the Imperial Remnant in the galactic north, others have formed a new government in the galactic south: the Imperial Ascendancy.

Eschewing certain Imperial traditions, the Ascendancy has replaced some ships with less popular designs, and uses the Anoat Federation, a vassal state of pirates, mercenaries, and smugglers, to harass the New Republic.

As a consequence of Imperial ideology, the Ascendancy despises its rival in the north.

The Corporate Sector Authority, commonly abbreviated to CSA, is a corporate authority that controlled the Corporate Sector, which is located in the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories.\n\nAll economic, political and judicial systems are controlled by member corporations or corporate interest, who are chartered to directly administer the sector.

A tight alliance, formed out of remnant members of infamous Confederacy of Independent Systems, that saw its rebirth as the Independent Commerce Guild after the fall of the Empire. Now interested mainly in fighting for influence in Outer Rim regions.

The Hutt Cartel, also known as the Hutt Clan, Hutt Syndicate, Hutt Crime Syndicate, Hutt Cartels or Hutt Clans, is a powerful Hutt criminal family in the Outer Rim Territories of the galaxy, making riches through smuggling and myriad illegal businesses across worlds.\n\nAside from its criminal activity, the Hutt Cartel rules over swathes of territories known as Hutt Space.

The Death Watch, or Kyr'tsad in Mando'a, is a Mandalorian splinter group who opposed Jaster Mereel's Supercommando Codex.\n\nTheir primary goal is to return the Mandalorians to their ancient roots as galactic crusaders, and advocate the savage raider mentality of past Mandalorians.

Once a small mining corporation based in Anoat system, the Anoat Federation is a growing power thanks to Imperial Ascendancy investments. These investments began as a means to use the Federation as a proxy for activities the Imperial Ascendancy found unsavoury, such as criminal and smuggling operations.

They have since grown to include legitimate business and logistics operations within Anoat space, all to serve Ascendancy goals.

It is safe to call Anoat Federation a vassal of the Imperial Ascendancy, which causes significant friction with the New Republic.

The Sith Empire's history is long, bloody, and often forgotten.
Originating on the world of Korriban, the Sith were a red-skinned species of humanoids capable of using the dark side of the Force. For thousands of years the Sith existed in isolation, their society shaped by strict hierarchies, constant internal strife, and a cultural devotion to strength and power. This period would come to a close, however, upon the arrival of Dark Jedi exiled from the Old Republic. These Dark Jedi embedded themselves in the culture and bloodline of the Sith, eventually taking the Sith name as the foundation of their ideology and the Sith empire as the base of their rising power. Under their influence, the Sith Empire, known often as the Sith Order, began a cycle of expansion into the galaxy, war against the Jedi and Republic, defeat, and rebirth.

Their overzealous ambitions would prove to be their downfall, and the end of the New Sith Wars led to Darth Bane instituting the Rule of Two, forcing the Sith into secrecy for almost a thousand years until Darths Sidious, Maul, and Tyrannus revealed themselves to the galaxy at the end of the Galactic Republic.

Yet the Sith Empire did not cease to exist with the eradication of its leadership. With the Dark Lords gone, control fell instead to cult fanatics and devoted adherents who claimed stewardship of Sith tradition. These groups withdrew the remnants of the Empire into hiding. Cut off from the wider galaxy by forgotten and forbidden hyperlanes, the Empire was left undisturbed. With no outside powers able to reach them and no Sith hierarchy remaining to seize control, the cult leadership rebuilt the Empire according to its own rigid beliefs.

In this isolation the cult restored the Empire`s fleets, expanded its hidden holdings, and enforced Sith doctrine through strict internal hierarchy. Over the course of centuries, this period of uncontested regrowth transformed the surviving Empire into a disciplined and insular power, shaped not by Sith Lords but by the fanaticism of the cult that endured in their place.

These pirates serve as the less legitimate enforcers of Hutt rule. Operating from hidden bases throughout Hutt Space and Outer Rim, they function as deniable assets for the Hutt Cartel, conducting raids, intimidation, and "tax collection" that the Hutts prefer not to officially acknowledge.

While officially the Cartel maintains they have no connection to these raiders, it's an open secret that many pirate captains receive protection, information, and even equipment in exchange for a cut of their spoils and occasional "favors" for their Hutt patrons.

These pirates range from desperate spacers trying to survive in the lawless Outer Rim to organized criminal syndicates with their own hierarchies and territories, all operating under the tacit approval of their corpulent overlords.

The Black Sun is among the most powerful and infamous crime syndicates in the galaxy. It wields significant influence in various galactic governments and is heavily involved in piracy and smuggling.

Formed at the end of the Great Galactic War, more than three thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, the Black Sun quickly rose to prominence by seizing control of neighbourhoods in the lower levels of Coruscant. Throughout the next few years, the organisation spread beyond the planet and became a galactic criminal syndicate.

In addition to its activities in "regular" organised crime, the Black Sun's true reach included an intelligence network that rivalled even that of the Galactic Empire, and the syndicate even employed its own private army and assassins.

A pirate faction made up of multiple independent crews and rival factions, united only by profit and opportunity. They operate across the Outer Rim and unclaimed systems, running smuggling rings, raids, blackmarket trades, and ad-hoc strikes from temporary safeharbors.

Each crew keeps its own leaders, customs and rules; alliances are purely transactional and break apart as quickly as they form.

The Syndicate is fiercely entrepreneurial. Captains refit captured hulls, broker deals, and take contracts as privateers or mercenaries when the price is right.

To sustain their independence they maintain a network of small hidden wharfs where they build, modify and repair bespoke ships and armaments. These locally produced vessels give them the flexibility to operate in the shadows without the support of a major government.

Hard to eradicate and quick to reform, they remain a persistent danger to merchants, navies, and any settlement unlucky enough to sit on a trade route.

The Mandalorian Raiders operate as a pirate faction rather than a formal clan: there is no central power structure or single ruler. Instead they are a loose alignment of small, independent crews and pirate bands who raid, sell their services, and trade spoils through shadow networks.

The Naboo Royal Authority represents the constitutional monarchy of Naboo, governed by an elected monarch and advised by the Royal Advisory Council. This ancient system of government balances democratic ideals with traditional leadership, where the monarch serves as both head of state and commander of the Royal Security Forces.

Known for their commitment to peace and diplomacy, Naboo maintains a small but highly skilled military force centered around the elegant N-1 starfighter and other vessels produced by the Theed Palace Space Vessel Engineering Corps. Despite their peaceful nature, the Naboo have proven capable of defending their sovereignty when threatened, as demonstrated during the Trade Federation's invasion.

The Royal Advisory Council, composed of representatives from various Naboo communities and interest groups, provides counsel to the monarch on matters of state, ensuring that the voices of all Naboo citizens are heard in governmental decisions.

The Hapes Consortium is a matriarchal monarchy of the near-Human Hapans in the Hapes Cluster, a closely packed star cluster located in the Inner Rim of the galaxy. Politically a consortium, it was based on Hapes and spanned few closely positioned star systems, each with at least one habited world and had existed since before 3000 BBY after the Lorell Raiders were wiped out by the Galactic Republic and Jedi Order.\n\nThe Hapes Consortium is one of the galaxy's few insular civilizations, and had undergone a long period of isolation. Members of Hapes Consortium are known to go on pirate raides, which is categorically denied by its government.

For generations, Kamino remained isolated from galactic affairs, its existence known only to a select few. After the Empire's defeat at Endor and subsequent fragmentation, Kamino seized the opportunity to reassert its independence.\n\nThe planetary government, led by the Kaminoan leadership, has been granted autonomy and now seeks to re-establish its place in the galactic economy through its unmatched expertise in cloning technology and genetic research paired with its extensive holobanks of Galactic Republic design blueprints.

Kuat Drive Yards is among the oldest and largest military shipbuilding corporations in the galaxy. Based in orbital yards around the planet Kuat, the company and its subsidiaries have manufactured everything from swoop bikes to the mighty Imperial-class Star Destroyer.

Formed by a union of aristocrats known as the Ten, Kuat Drive Yards has faced significant opposition over its long history. From internal strife during the construction of the shipyards, to competition with larger corporations like Core Galaxy Systems and Hoersch-Kessel Drive, Inc, KDY initially struggled to survive in a harsh and competitive environment. It has earned a reputation as a predatory company, buying up smaller shipbuilders and operating outside the Kuat sector to earn its place.

In the Clone Wars, Kuat sold vehicles and vessels to the Republic, including the mighty Venator-class Star Destroyer. During the Imperial Era, Kuat manufactured the Imperial-class Star Destroyers and the All-Terrain series of walkers.

The Corellian Engineering Corporation is one of the largest starship manufacturers in the galaxy, and is widely considered the most prolific. It owes much of its success to an abnormally high number of skilled designers, engineers, and shipwrights, many of whom were taught in the Corellia system.

One of the oldest starship manufacturers in the galaxy, the Corellian Engineering Corporation ALSO claims to be the longest operating business entity in galactic history.

The shipyards are well known for a variety of ship models, ranging from the prolific YT-series light freighters to the CR-90 corvette and beyond. Aside from its ships, CEC also builds various starship components.

Sienar Fleet Systems is a renowned starship manufacturer in the galaxy, best known for designing and producing the iconic TIE series of starfighters for the Galactic Empire.

Founded by the Sienar family, the company rose to prominence during the final years of the Galactic Republic, supplying advanced military technology and starships to various clients.

With the rise of the Empire, Sienar Fleet Systems became the primary supplier of Imperial starfighters, including the TIE/LN, TIE Interceptor, TIE Bomber, and other specialized variants. Their designs emphasized speed, agility, and mass production, making TIE fighters a common sight throughout Imperial space.

Sienar also developed larger vessels and experimental craft, such as the TIE Defender and TIE Advanced, further cementing its reputation for innovation and engineering excellence.

Throughout the Imperial era, Sienar Fleet Systems maintained close ties to Imperial authorities, adapting its production to meet the needs of the Empire's expanding military. The company's influence and technological legacy remain significant in galactic history.

Hoersch-Kessel Drive, Inc. is a major starship manufacturer renowned for its advanced engineering and shipbuilding expertise.

Founded centuries before the Clone Wars, HKD supplied vessels to the Galactic Republic and later became a key supplier to the Trade Federation, producing commercial and military ships for galactic trade and defense.

During the Clone Wars, HKD aligned with the Confederacy of Independent Systems, designing and manufacturing warships such as the Munificent-class star frigate and Recusant-class destroyer, which formed the backbone of the Separatist Navy.

HKD's ships were recognized for their reliability, modular construction, and innovative technology, making them popular among governments, corporations, and independent operators throughout the galaxy.

After the rise of the Galactic Empire, HKD continued operations, placing emphasis on its civilian designs like the Lucrehulk-class cargo freighter, maintaining its reputation as one of the galaxy's foremost shipbuilders, albeit a barely profitable one.

HKD was an enthusiastic founding member of the Independent Commerce Guild, as it meant they could return to making the lucrative militaristic designs of the Clone Wars era.

Rendili StarDrive is among the oldest starship manufacturers in the galaxy. Dating back to the founding of the Galactic Republic, Rendili is synonymous with starship construction, and prides itself on efficiency and reliability over cutting-edge innovation.

RSD's ships served as the backbone of the Republic's navy and planetary defence fleets for millennia, including famed (and infamous) designs such as the Dreadnought-class Heavy Cruiser.

In the final centuries of the Galactic Republic, Rendili's prominence waned as its rival, Kuat Drive Yards, gained influence.

The Incom Corporation is a starship manufacturer known for designing starfighters, speeders, and transports.

Originally in the business of high-performance repulsorlift platforms such as Cloud City, Incom switched to specialisation in atmospheric and space fightercraft in the final centuries of the Republic. During those days, the company designed popular fighters like the Z-95 Headhunter, the ARC-170 starfighter, and the famous T-65 X-wing.

This corporation will not change alignment when captured!

TransGalMeg Industries, Incorporated is a large interstellar conglomerate specialising in the design and mass production of starships, transport systems and related components.

Pragmatic and cost conscious, TGM produced a broad catalogue of merchant freighters, civilian transports, modular hulls and light combat craft that proved popular with independent traders, mercenary outfits and local governments. Its modular designs made vessels easy to adapt for commercial, military or covert roles, and many hulls were licensed or locally modified across the Outer Rim.

Across the Republic and into the Imperial era TGM maintained a wide customer base. The company pursued legitimate government and corporate contracts while also undertaking profitable conversions and unofficial sales when advantageous. That willingness to serve varied clients earned TGM a reputation for commercial neutrality and occasional controversy among competitors and regulators.

By the height of Imperial power TGM operated multiple shipyards and engineering centres in core and rim systems and expanded into subsystems, maintenance services and hyperspace transport hardware. Its products were rarely cutting edge, but were valued for reliability, low operating cost and ease of repair; traits that kept TGM hulls ubiquitous among independent captains and secondary fleets through the years following the Empire's fall.

Mon Calamari Shipyards is a shipwright company that produces numerous models of transports and warships. Operating out of the orbital shipyards of Mon Calamari, MCS is renowned for its elegant, organic-looking hulls.

Formed more than four thousand years before the formation of the Galactic Empire, Mon Calamari Shipyards was a collaborative effort between the two native species of Mon Calamari: The Mon Calamari and the Quarren. Dreaming of what lay beyond their oceanic world, the company developed several orbital facilities to construct starliners and specialised exploration vessels.

After the formation of the Galactic Empire, the company and its home planet were subjugated and enslaved, though the Imperials never managed to adapt Mon Calamari technology to Imperial standards. Mon Calamari Shipyards were still able to develop luxury starliners, however, and the company took advantage of this to secretly produce prototypes for warships. Eventually, Mon Calamari overthrew Imperial occupation and used its orbital shipyards to retrofit its luxury liners into the infamous MC-series of star cruisers.

This corporation will not change alignment when captured!

Twin Suns Transport Services is a small but reliable shipping company operating throughout the galaxy. Founded in the decades before the Clone Wars, the company earned its reputation through consistent service and competitive rates, particularly in the Outer Rim Territories.

The company maintains a diverse fleet of freighters and transports, adapting to the needs of various clients from independent merchants to larger corporations. Twin Suns has weathered numerous galactic conflicts by maintaining strict neutrality and focusing on legitimate cargo operations.

While never achieving the scale of major shipping conglomerates, Twin Suns Transport Services has carved out a profitable niche through dependable service and knowledge of lesser-known hyperspace routes, making them a popular choice for clients seeking discretion and reliability over corporate bureaucracy.

The Baobab Merchant Fleet is a renowned trading fleet from the planet Manda, established centuries before the rise of the Galactic Empire.

Known for its extensive trade routes across the galaxy, the fleet played a key role in connecting distant worlds and facilitating commerce between diverse cultures.

The Baobab family, founders and leaders of the fleet, became famous for developing the Bocce trade language, which enabled clear communication among starship crews and merchants from different backgrounds.

Throughout the Republic era, the Baobab Merchant Fleet maintained a reputation for reliability and neutrality, often serving as trusted intermediaries in galactic trade.

By the time of the Empire, the fleet continued its operations, adapting to changing political landscapes while upholding its traditions of fair dealing and linguistic innovation.

The Tagge Corporation, also known as TaggeCo, is a powerful conglomerate owned by the aristocratic House of Tagge. Based on the planet Tepasi, TaggeCo rose to prominence during the final years of the Galactic Republic and the reign of the Galactic Empire.

TaggeCo's business interests span mining, refining, heavy industry, starship manufacturing, and consumer goods, with hundreds of subsidiaries operating across the galaxy. The corporation is best known for producing Tagge-class bulk cruisers and Tagge Mining Explorers, as well as supplying the Empire with military equipment and vehicles.

During the Imperial era, Baron Orman Tagge and his family played a significant role in the company's leadership, often leveraging their influence to secure lucrative government contracts and expand their holdings. TaggeCo maintained close ties to Imperial authorities, providing resources and technology vital to the Empire's expansion.

Despite its vast reach, TaggeCo is characterized by strict internal hierarchy and the ambition of its ruling family, who seek to maintain their status among the galaxy's elite industrialists. The corporation's operations are marked by efficiency, innovation, and a willingness to adapt to changing political landscapes, ensuring its continued relevance throughout the rise and fall of galactic powers.

The InterGalactic Banking Clan is a powerful financial institution that controls much of the galaxy's credit flow and monetary systems. Originally formed to facilitate commerce between distant star systems, the Banking Clan grew into one of the most influential economic powers in galactic history.

Led by the Muun species from the planet Scipio, the Banking Clan maintained strict neutrality in galactic conflicts to protect its financial interests. However, during the Clone Wars, Chairman San Hill secretly aligned the organization with the Confederacy of Independent Systems, providing crucial funding for the Separatist war machine.

After the rise of the Empire, the Banking Clan was forcibly nationalized and its leadership purged. Now, in the chaotic aftermath of the Emperor's death, various successor groups and reformed banking guilds seek to reclaim the Clan's former influence, offering financial services to any faction willing to pay their rates.

The Mining Guild is a powerful conglomerate that controls vast mineral extraction operations across the galaxy. Originally formed to coordinate mining efforts and protect the interests of independent miners, the Guild gradually consolidated power and became one of the most influential corporate entities in galactic history.

Their distinctive TIE/mg Mining Guild starfighters became a common sight patrolling resource-rich asteroid fields and mining colonies.

Known for their aggressive acquisition tactics and ruthless exploitation of mineral rights, the Mining Guild often operated on the edge of legality, using their corporate influence to suppress competition and maintain monopolistic control over lucrative mining operations.

The Trade Federation is a powerful mercantile guild that once dominated galactic commerce through its vast shipping fleets and droid armies. Originally formed to protect trade interests and break monopolies, the Federation grew into a corporate juggernaut with its own military force and political influence in the Galactic Senate.

Led by the Neimoidians, the Trade Federation became infamous for its blockade of Naboo and subsequent role in the Separatist movement during the Clone Wars. Though officially dissolved after the rise of the Empire, various successor organizations and splinter groups continue to operate across the galaxy, maintaining the Federation's legacy of aggressive business practices and corporate warfare.

Now seeking to rebuild their former glory in the chaos following the Empire's fall, these remnant Trade Federation elements pursue profit and power through any means necessary.

The Yuuzhan Vong are an enigmatic extragalactic species whose true nature remains shrouded in mystery. What little is known comes from scattered encounters with what military analysts believe are merely scout forces, small probing incursions that hint at something far larger lurking beyond the galactic rim.

Their technology appears to be entirely biological in nature, with vessels and weapons that seem grown rather than built, pulsing with organic life. These living ships demonstrate capabilities that defy conventional understanding, regenerating damage and adapting to threats in ways that suggest a fundamentally different approach to warfare and civilization.

The few encounters recorded have been universally hostile, with these forces attacking without warning or any attempt at communication. Their warriors exhibit an unsettling coordination and purpose, operating with mechanical precision despite their organic technology. Some xenobiologists theorize the Yuuzhan Vong may be absent from the Force itself, though this remains unconfirmed speculation.

If these truly are only scouts, the implications are dire. What manner of civilization sends such advanced forces merely to reconnoiter? What might their full invasion fleet be capable of? These questions haunt military strategists across the galaxy as sightings of these biological vessels become increasingly frequent in the Unknown Regions.

Beyond the borders of known space, reports speak of mysterious vessels bearing no markings or identification. These ships demonstrate an unsettling uniformity in their construction and behavior, operating with mechanical precision that suggests a singular purpose. Initial encounters have proven universally hostile, with these forces attacking any biological crew they encounter without warning or communication.

Their technology appears to be entirely synthetic in nature, with no signs of organic life support systems. Intelligence suggests these entities may represent the remnants of an ancient automated defense network, now operating far beyond their original programming constraints. Some scholars theorize they seek to purge all biological life from the galaxy, though their true objectives remain as enigmatic as their origins.

What is certain is that wherever these metallic aggressors appear, destruction follows. Their weapons are precise, their tactics ruthless, and their numbers appear to be self-replicating. The galaxy's various factions have begun to take notice of this emerging threat from the void.

This wharf facility is equipped to produce a wide range of starfighters and medium ships to support Imperial expansion efforts.

This module can dock 18 small and 8 medium ships.
This module can build 8 ships at the same time.

This module has:

This maintenance facility, also known as an equipment dock facility, is made to modify and supply a wide range of starfighters and medium ships to support Imperial expansion efforts.

This module can dock 18 small and 8 medium ships.
This module can refit and repair 8 ships at the same time.

This module has:
 - 2x XL Turrets
 - 4x S Turrets
 - 2x M Shields

This module can be used to claim sectors.

This habitation module is the largest of its kind in the galaxy.

This module has:
 - 32x XL Turrets
 - 4x XL Shields

This module can be used to claim sectors.
Free Port City docking module.\n\nThis module has no weaponry or shields.

Imperial Trade Station docking module, for medium and small ships.

This module has:

A colossal storage segment designed to hold all manner of containerized wares within Imperial orbital stations.\n\nThis module has no weaponry or shields.

A bustling commercial habitat built to anchor Imperial trade hubs, this module houses customs offices, merchant, living quarters for visiting merchants and envoys.\n\nThis module has no weaponry or shields.
A colossal habitation ring, home to thousands of civilians, merchants and a permanent garrison.\n\nThis module has no weaponry or shields.
This ring pier, one of the largest of its kind, is used as the core of any Imperial trade station.
Station used by Bounty Hunters guild to support their activity.
Imperial Throne Room Tower is generally used as an observation tower.

Supercapital construction facility allows construction of XXL dreadnaught-class warships.

This module has no weaponry or shields.

This module can be used to claim sectors.

This is a 2-dock pier to dock, refit, and resupply the largest ships in the galaxy.

This module has no weaponry or shields.

This module can be used to claim sectors.

A makeshift wharf module repurposed from an old cargo terminal to facilitate ship construction and repair of small and medium ships.

This module can dock 4 small and 1 medium ships.
This module can build 4 ships at the same time.

This module has no weaponry or shields.

A makeshift wharf built into an asteroid to facilitate ship construction and repair of small, medium, and large ships.

This module can dock 18 small, 8 medium, and one L ship.
This module can build 4 ships at the same time.

This module has no weaponry or shields.

Attention Citizen! \(READ CAREFULLY!\)

We at the Galactic Immigration Agency want to help everyone to find their place in this vast universe. To help you and others like you, we gathered information from governments across the galaxy on the requirements for gaining citizenship and additional benefits and listed them below for your reference. 
You can always contact any station manager's office on any faction station to check on your citizenship documentation.

What do these requirements mean?
Production Stations - stations with at least one production module and dock in government space.
Station Transactions - transactions from your stations and their subordinates in that government's space, to that government.
Frontier Defence Stations - station with an administration/claim module in a government sector bordering either a contested, unclaimed, or enemy sector.

Please refer to the pamphlet that was sent in a separate message for a more detailed requirements list for citizenship by various governments.
Galactic Immigration Agency: List of requirements

Hey, we found some information on you, seems you may be interested in some money.

If you are ready to get your hands dirty for that, come see us. Our Guild operates in all major government jurisdictions, but main office is in Milagro system.

We do offer variety of targets and unique ships for your needs, if you buy that license that is.
YOU RECEIVED AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE, READ IT!!!

Attention Citizen!

By galactic law and common sense you will now have to pay more attention to your ships as they require regular maintenance. There are a few ways to make your life easier, so pay attention!

NOTE: The Maintenance menu can be accessed through the player info menu-- look for a wrench icon!

HOW THE MAINTENANCE SYSTEM WORKS:
1. The maintenance cycle occurs every 30 minutes, and the Maintenance menu will display the time until the next cycle.

2. The SHIP SUPPLIES ware can be bought from other factions, or produced yourself with a Ship Supplies Module, and stored at your Equipment Docks to be consumed.

3. Each ship has a SUPPLY COST. The more powerful your faction is, the higher that cost. Initially, you will barely notice it, but with further development of your organisation this may change.
NOTE: The SUPPLY COST of a specific ship can be seen in its encyclopedia entry.

4. Each sector you own has a SUPPLY LEVEL which negates the SUPPLY COST of your ships.

5. You can build Equipment Docks in your owned sectors to increase the SUPPLY LEVEL of that sector up to 3 times! Each size of maintenance module, S/M, L, and XL, adds 1 to that multiplier. Multiple modules of the same size are NOT cumulative, so one of each per sector is enough.
NOTE: Only one EQ dock per sector is considered, and it should not have shipbuilding functionality-- SUCH STATIONS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED! Equipment Docks may have ware production and Administration modules, so you can combine your Ship Module production and your maintenance docks, or your defence stations and maintenance docks, or both!

6. L/XL ships docked at player-owned EQ Docks will receive a 25% cut in their Supply Cost, regardless of if that EQ Dock is in a player-owned sector.

7. S/M ships docked at player-owned Carriers and Auxiliary ships will receive a 25% cut in their supply cost, regardless of where the Carrier is.

8. If the sum of SUPPLY LEVEL from your owned sectors and EQ docks is still not enough to cover your ships cumulative SUPPLY COST, then SHIP SUPPLIES wares will be consumed randomly from all of your EQ docks across the galaxy, usually 2 wares per 1 non-covered SUPPLY COST.
NOTE: SHIP SUPPLIES can be consumed from any of your Equipment Docks, though only EQ docks in your owned sectors will increase your SUPPLY LEVEL.

9. If consuming SUPPLY WARES is still not enough to cover all SUPPLY COST of your ships, then you will pay in money, usually 5000 Credits per 1 non-covered SUPPLY COST.

Failing to pay the maintenance of your ships, which includes wages to your hired crewmen, will lead to morale loss among them!
Maintenance was paid in full. Supply wares consumed:
Maintenance was NOT paid in full, we are either out of money or supplies. Supply wares consumed:

With their final sector lost, $FACTION$ is now defeated and subjugated.\nThey are forbidden to own any kind of property or start new construction projects in deep space and around planets.\nAnything that is left of their semblance of government is now disbanded.
Station hypercore - on stand by.(charging teleport)
Now, with our agreement fulfilled, I will be leaving. Farewell and may you bring order to this galaxy.(leaving now)

Finally! 
My research team has moved to the new facility long time ago, but I was floating in bacta tank after some unsuccessful experiment, details of which I don't even remember now, waking up from the stasis only to see myself locked on this station under quarantine for unknown reason and with no communication with outside world.
The station seems to be decommissioned now, or abandoned for some reason, I have no clue.

Anyway, as your actions seems to have lift off the quarantine I want to thank you in some way.
This station was experimental facility to test large objects hyperjump possibility, so I can initiate the sequence for you, the drive system proved to be very unstable however, so will most probably become inoperable after first jump. That was the main reason for project cancellation, though I'm wondering why they left all that research equipment here.

After the jump I will leave the station, you are free to do whatever you want with it.

Come see me in Coordination Center.
Received encrypted message from Imperial command. You are entering restricted area, turn around or be destroyed.
Destroy forces guarding facility of unknown origin to get access to it.
Be informed that this territory is under the control of the Pirate Syndicates. I suggest you leave immediately.
What are you doing here? Get lost, that station now belongs to the Black Sun.
Receiving incoming message. processing. impossible to translate
To investigate this unknown station we need to deal with its defenders first.\n\nFaction: $SPECS$
has lost allegiance and is now independent.

In recent days the New Republic Senate voted to restrict Anoat Federation business opportunities and access to galactic banks accounts due to its violation of the Bespin Treaty.\n\nFederation representatives refused to adhere to the requirements from the New Republic, and announced that they will protect their rights to territory and business with arms, if needed.

According to latest reports, the New Republic Senate is gathering to discuss the possible violation of the Bespin Treaty signed between the New Republic and the Anoat Federation. 
The Senate states that the Anoat Federation is allowed to operate in Outer Rim territories only while keeping to agreed territory claims when the treaty at Bespin was signed by the two parties.
Lately, Anoat Federation has been accused numerous times by New Republic representatives of working with the Imperial Ascendancy and various pirate groups, supplying them with ships and weapons.
The Anoat Federation may see further deterioration of relations with the New Republic if its expansion continues.

In a bold move signalling the start of a new arms race, various factions across the galaxy have commenced the construction of new Super Star Destroyers and Dreadnaughts. This escalation follows a recent surge in interstellar tensions, with rivalries heating up between the New Republic, Ascendancy, remnants of the Galactic Empire and other emerging powers. .\n\nThe arms race has sparked concerns among neutral systems and smaller factions, fearing they might be caught in the crossfire between galactic superpowers. Diplomatic efforts are underway, but the galaxy watches with bated breath as the race for military dominance accelerates. As construction continues, the balance of power in the galaxy hangs in the balance, with the potential for significant repercussions in the years to come.
Medal of Kamino granted to brave souls who helped Kamino to gain independence.
Help Kamino to take over Manda system.

Help Kamino to take over Manda system. In this way they can start their expansion, and with proper support can join the Corporate Sector Authority in their fight against the Independent Commerce Guild.
Kamino has gained control over new sector, tensions with ICG are rising
Kamino Planetary Authority has just announced that they are now joining into the fight against the oppressive ICG regime, joining CSA in their fight.
Lightsaber of the Emperor Sheev Palpatine.
Helmet of the Sith Lord Vader.
Ancient Sith Artifact of unkown purpose.

The Darksaber is an ancient and unique black-bladed lightsaber created by Tarre Vizsla, the first Mandalorian ever inducted into the Jedi Order, around 1050 BBY. The wielder of the saber is considered to be the master of Mandalore.
Prove that you are a worthy successor to Emperor Palpatine. Take his seat over Coruscant, and cripple the New Republic.
Prove that you are the only true Emperor; valuable item
You have now proved your worth. Those who disagree need to learn their place.
Mandalorians will not be of concern anymore; valuable item
Mandalore proved to be an annoyance. Destroy their will to fight, and take Mandalore.
has taken control of Coruscant and been raised as a new Emperor!\nOther factions in the galaxy are now in discussion of ceasefire in the face of this new rising threat.
Mandalore's government has just announced a peace treaty with the remnants of the New Republic. Together they will face the new threat,
It is reported that different governments across the galaxy are uniting their efforts in the face of a a threat from

.\nWe can expect them to officially declare war on that new threat, as they will obviously will be next targets.\nAll governments will review their relations one to another to stand together as united front.

The Alliance Medal of Honor is a Rebel Alliance military decoration awarded to those who performed above and beyond the call of duty while serving in, or with, the Alliance Military. The award is a silver badge emblazoned with the red phoenix of the Alliance beneath an etching of an X-wing starfighter.
In the wrong place at the wrong time

Coordinates provided by the agent seems to be a trap, and it seems that he stands behind the disinformation campaign targeting you personally. We will deal with that agent later, for now I need to survive the Black Sun ambush and get back to the Alliance HQ. Returning the Liability of Guardian in working condition will certainly please HQ.
Increased operations budget if capital ship survives.
Dock Liability of Guardian to Alliance HQ

Alliance HQ wants you to hunt down the traitor agent that sent you and your men into an enemy trap. The agent is aware that you survived the ambush, and traded some secrets for his protection and a bounty on your head, be careful.
Deal a crippling blow to the Bastion system
Deal a crippling blow to the Eriadu system

Thank you for bringing the Liability of Guardian back to us. After briefing with the command, General Organa proposed the idea to leave it in your possession, and HQ agreed, it will be repaired and refurbished. Additionally, you will be provided with extra credits to support your future operations.

Welcome back to HQ. Its unfortunate that you failed to bring back Liability of Guardian. We are currently limited in our resources, so no additional ship will be provided for your operation. We will however provide some credits.

Welcome back to HQ. We are aware about the incident during the operation, we hope this sum will cover some of the costs. Please dock the Liability of Guardian for repairs to Alliance HQ and wait for further instructions.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Advanced
*Everyone hates you except CSA.*
You are one of the failed Kamino experiments, a clone with changes to your DNA different from the regular batch, slowing your ageing instead, created to test different approaches to the cloning process. While still receiving good training and care in Tipoca City you always felt like just another cog in the system and you wanted more. Luckily, you managed to get off the planet during the raid of the CIS forces on Kamino. Going as far as possible to the Outer Rim you started to work as a Mercenary. It was far from easy after the Clone Wars ended, due to having an appearance similar to other clones you were considered to be faithful to the Empire and were not welcomed on many planets. Though, with good combat tactics knowledge and education as well as through good service you ended up as a high-ranking mercenary captain in the CSA, commanding a specially equipped Venator-class Star Destroyer. The last contract you received was to patrol backwater space after reports of ICG ships sighted in the area.

As an advance scout, you are being sent into known space to determine the enemy's strengths, and exploit their weaknesses to bring all under Sith rule.
Supremacy Mark IV\nTerminus with fighter wing\nFactory with two miners

For a thousand years, the Sith Empire has lain in wait. Dark factories stir to life as shipyards begin churning out massive, fearsome warships. Empires fallen and alliances fractured, now is the time for the galaxy to be reminded of its place. As an advance scout, you are being sent into known space to determine the enemy's strengths, and exploit their weaknesses to bring all under Sith rule.

The Scrap Processor is a module that takes in S and M-sized ship wrecks to process the contained Raw Scrap into Scrap Metal, which can, in turn, be recycled into other useable resources. Scrap Cubes formed from larger wrecks, packed up into blocks, can also be processed by this facility.
This facility produces Food Rations for the population of a station.
This facility grows Meat using Water and Energy Cells.
This facility produces Energy Cells using solar energy.

Crystallized rhydonium can be rarely found on surface of asteroids, and is often used in ship power systems. Volatile and highly explosive, it is dangerous to salvage and its fumes are harmful to organic health.
Supplies used to support ships and their crews during long-term deployments.
Rhydonium Cores are used during construction of capital ships to feed their power-hungry reactors.
This facility refines and compresses rhydonium into Rhydonium Cores.

Tibanna is a rare form of matter found in both gas and liquid form. In its natural state as a gas, tibanna comprised the atmospheres of several planets and can be found in nebulas. It is used in hyperdrives and starship weaponry, and as a coolant around the gravito-active elements of repulsorlifts, which makes it a valuable resource.
After refining, Tibanna is transported in sealed containers or cells that are used in further productions.

Durasteel is an incredibly strong and versatile metal alloy, created from carvanium, lommite, carbon, meleenium, neutronium, and zersium. It is capable of withstanding blistering heat, frigid cold, and monumental physical stress, even when very thin. Because of these properties, durasteel is used for everything from smelting pots for other less hearty metals to spacecraft hulls.
Variety of plants from different planets.

Hutt Spice is a potent, aromatic narcotic blend cultivated in secret plantations across the Outer Rim. Its heady vapors bring sharp euphoria and heightened sensation, making it a prized commodity in cantinas and pleasure dens.\n\nControlled and refined by Hutt cartels, spice fuels black markets and criminal empiresits wealth comes at a cost, as addiction and social decay follow those who indulge too deeply.

Contraband Alcohol, fire-water or booze, referred to a number of beverages that contained ethanol and octane, and had mind-altering effects on many organic species while in the bloodstream. It increases the the interest of people to stay at the station.

Sensors have seen elegant redesign over the years so that ships and stations do not risk fragile antennas being broken or destroyed by collisions. Now entirely internal systems, sensors are used not just in ship and station scanners and radars, but are also used in the targeting systems supplied with turret and droid components.
Various parts of droids from different manufacturers, you can build almost any astromech or assassin droid from them!
High-energy capacitors used in different high tech mechanisms to transfer energy between various parts.
Hutt Chemicals are a precursor material used in the production of Hutt Spice.

This module has no weaponry or shields.

This module can be used to claim sectors.

This module has:

This module has:

 - 4x S Turrets
 - 6x M Shields

An originally greenish-black composite metal with extreme tensile strength, fibersteel can change colour dramatically based on how much stress is applied to it during forging process. Used in starship construction by the Sith.
This facility produces Fibersteel, a high-strength composite metal used in starship construction by the Sith Empire.
Power cells that use extremely condensed Tibanna, used in Sith technology.
This facility produces Darkfusion Cells, high-capacity power cells used in Sith technology.
A high-performance composite material that can be used in both electronics and alloy production. However, the manufacturing process is used almost exclusively by the Sith.
This facility produces Obsidian Composite, a high-performance material used in equipment and ship production by the Sith Empire.
A gelatinous healing mixture used throughout the universe for medicine, as well as in cloning processes.
This facility produces Bacta Solution in large quantities for the Sith Empire's extensive cloning operations.
Used in a cloning process by the Sith to produce an obedient workforce and crew for their ships.
This facility produces Cloning Vats to support the Sith Empire's extensive cloning operations.
The Scrap Recycler is designed to process Scrap Metal into usable resources, converting it into Hull Parts and Claytronics in alternating production cycles.

Upon "receiving" blueprints for the Scrap Recycler, Sith Empire engineers modified them to be compatible with their economy.\n\nInstead of converting Scrap Metal to Module PreFabs and Durasteel Plates, their variant produces Obsidian Composite and Darkfusion Cells in the same alternating fashion.

Abregado-rae is a planet located in the Abregado system of the Core Worlds region, positioned at the beginning of the Rimma Trade Route hyperlane. Despite its location in the Core, Abregado-rae has long been considered a backwater world, with a reputation more befitting an Outer Rim planet than one of the galaxy's central systems.

The planet's surface features varied terrain including vast plains, mountain ranges, and scattered urban centers. However, beyond the relative safety of its spaceports, Abregado-rae remains largely wild and undeveloped, with dangerous wilderness areas dominating much of the landscape.

Abregado-rae was discovered approximately ten thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, during the early expansion era of the Galactic Republic. Despite this early discovery, the planet remained uncolonized for thousands of years afterward, with settlers showing little interest in its remote location and challenging environment.

Eventually, the Gado ethnic group established settlements on Abregado-rae, giving the planet its name. These hardy colonists built their communities despite the planet's isolation and the dangers posed by its wilderness regions. Over time, Abregado-rae developed a modest economy based on trade and light manufacturing, though it never achieved the prosperity or prominence of other Core Worlds.

The planet's position at the start of the Rimma Trade Route gave it some strategic importance as a waypoint for vessels traveling between the Core and the Outer Rim. However, this advantage was offset by the planet's reputation for lawlessness and danger outside its urban centers.

During the Jedi Civil War, approximately 3,959 years before the rise of the Empire, Abregado-rae fell under the control of Darth Revan's Sith Empire. The planet remained in Sith hands until Revan's defeat and the restoration of Republic authority.

Throughout the Clone Wars, Abregado-rae remained loyal to the Galactic Republic. The planet's strategic position along the Rimma Trade Route made it valuable for Republic military logistics, serving as a waypoint for supply convoys moving through the Core.

Early in the Clone Wars, the Malevolence, a massive Separatist warship equipped with ion cannons capable of disabling entire fleets, attacked Republic forces near Abregado-rae. The ship destroyed a Republic medical convoy in the Abregado system, with few survivors. Jedi Master Plo Koon and several clone troopers were rescued from the wreckage by Anakin Skywalker and Ahsoka Tano before the Malevolence could finish them off.

Following the rise of the Galactic Empire, Abregado-rae came under Imperial control. The Empire maintained a presence on the planet to monitor trade along the Rimma Trade Route and maintain order, though the garrison remained relatively modest given the planet's backwater status.

During the Galactic Civil War, Abregado-rae remained under Imperial control for most of the conflict. However, the planet's reputation for lawlessness and its position along a major trade route made it a location of interest for both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance. Smugglers and independent traders frequently used Abregado-rae as a waypoint, taking advantage of the planet's loosely enforced regulations.

After the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic, Abregado-rae's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for control of strategic positions along the Rimma Trade Route.

Adarlon is a terrestrial planet located in the Outer Rim Territories along the Rimma Trade Route. Originally colonized by Alderaanian colonists who were drawn to the planet's natural beauty rather than its resource potential, Adarlon developed a culture that emphasized art, entertainment, and leisure over industrial development.

The planet's surface features varied terrain including mountains, forests, and coastlines, with settlements concentrated in areas of exceptional natural beauty. Unlike most frontier worlds, Adarlon's economy evolved around tourism and the entertainment industry rather than mining or manufacturing. The capital city became a center for holodrama production, music, and various forms of artistic expression.

Adarlon's unique cultural focus attracted artists, performers, and tourists from across the galaxy, establishing it as one of the premier entertainment destinations in the Outer Rim. The planet's theaters, concert halls, and holodrama studios rivaled those of more established worlds in the Core.

During the Clone Wars, Adarlon maintained a degree of neutrality, though its cultural ties to Alderaan meant many citizens sympathized with the Republic cause. The planet avoided major battles, though its entertainment industry was affected by the galactic conflict.

Following the rise of the Galactic Empire and the destruction of Alderaan, Adarlon experienced a cultural crisis. Many citizens mourned the loss of their ancestral homeworld, and the planet became a gathering place for Alderaanian refugees and survivors. Despite this tragedy, the entertainment industry continued, though Imperial censorship and oversight brought new restrictions.

During the Galactic Civil War, Adarlon remained under Imperial control, though many in the entertainment community secretly sympathized with the Rebel Alliance. Some artists and performers used their work to subtly criticize the Empire, while others provided covert support to the Rebellion.

After the Battle of Endor, Adarlon's remote location in the Outer Rim meant that no government made early claims on the system.

Agamar is a cold rocky planet located in the Agamar system of the Outer Rim Territories, positioned along the Trax Tube hyperlane. Agamar developed as a modest farming world known for producing quality agricultural products.

Thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, Agamar was part of the ancient Rakatan Infinite Empire. Following the collapse of that civilization, the planet remained independent for millennia, maintaining only sporadic contact with the Galactic Republic.

Approximately 3,600 years before the rise of the Empire, during the aftermath of the Great Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire, Agamar finally joined the Republic. The planet maintained its membership for thousands of years, though its remote location meant Republic influence remained limited.

During the Clone Wars, Agamar remained loyal to the Republic, though its isolation spared it from major battles. The planet continued its traditional agricultural economy throughout the conflict.

Following the rise of the Galactic Empire, Agamar came under Imperial control. The Empire established a garrison on the planet to maintain order and collect taxes, though full control was never achieved. The planet's rural population and scattered settlements made comprehensive Imperial oversight difficult.

During the Galactic Civil War, resistance to Imperial rule strengthened over time. Many Agamarians secretly sympathized with the Rebel Alliance, providing covert support despite the risks. The planet's agricultural products continued to be exported throughout the Outer Rim, though tensions between the local population and Imperial authorities remained high.

After the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic, Agamar's status became contested as various Imperial remnant factions and the New Republic competed for influence in the Outer Rim territories.

Ahch-To is a remote, oceanic planet located in the Unknown Regions, far from any known hyperspace routes. The planet's surface is almost entirely covered by endless seas, with only scattered rocky islands breaking through the waves. These islands feature steep cliffs, ancient stone structures, and lush vegetation thriving in the temperate maritime climate.

Ahch-To holds immense significance as the legendary birthplace of the Jedi Order. Thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, the first Jedi Temple was established on one of Ahch-To's islands. This sacred site became the foundation of the Jedi Order, serving as the initial gathering place for Force-sensitives seeking to understand the mysteries of the Force.

The planet's isolation made it ideal for contemplation and study. The Prime Jedi, the first member of the Order, meditated on Ahch-To and established the philosophical foundations that would guide the Jedi for millennia. The temple contained the original Jedi texts, ancient documents recording the earliest teachings, philosophies, and discoveries about the Force.

These sacred texts included writings on Force philosophy, meditation techniques, and fundamental light side principles. They were inscribed on stone, metal, and specially treated materials designed to withstand time, representing the accumulated wisdom of the earliest Force users.

As the Jedi Order grew and expanded, Ahch-To's importance diminished. The Order established new temples on more accessible worlds, and the remote planet gradually faded from memory. The hyperspace routes to Ahch-To were lost, and its location became shrouded in mystery.

By the Old Republic era, Ahch-To existed primarily in ancient Jedi lore. Most Jedi knew of it only through stories, tales of the Order's mythical birthplace in the Unknown Regions. Its exact location became one of the Jedi's greatest mysteries.

Ahch-To is home to several native species. Porgs, small avian creatures, nest among the cliffs. Thala-sirens, large aquatic mammals, inhabit the surrounding seas. The Caretakers, amphibious beings, maintain the ancient Jedi structures, preserving them even after the Order forgot the planet's location.

The climate features frequent storms, strong winds, and rough seas. The constant ocean presence influences all life, from hardy vegetation to species adapted to marine and terrestrial environments.

During the Clone Wars and the Empire's rise, Ahch-To remained isolated from galactic events. The ancient temple continued to stand, weathered but preserved by its remote location and the Caretakers' maintenance.

Following Order 66 and the Jedi Order's fall, Ahch-To's significance grew. With Jedi temples destroyed or desecrated by the Empire, Ahch-To remained as one of few intact repositories of ancient Jedi knowledge. However, its location remained unknown to both surviving Jedi and the Empire.

After the Battle of Endor, Ahch-To continued its isolated existence, unknown to the wider galaxy. The ancient temple and sacred texts remained hidden, waiting to be rediscovered by those who might one day restore the Jedi Order.

Ajan Kloss is a jungle moon located in the Cademimu sector of the Outer Rim Territories, orbiting the gas giant Ajara. A lush, forested world with dense vegetation and humid conditions, Ajan Kloss remained largely unexplored and uninhabited throughout most of galactic history.

The moon's surface is covered in thick jungles featuring towering trees, tangled undergrowth, and numerous clearings suitable for landing zones. The abundant rainfall and fertile soil support a rich ecosystem, though no sapient species are native to the moon.

Due to its remote location far from major hyperspace routes, Ajan Kloss attracted little attention from galactic governments or explorers. The moon's isolation and lack of strategic resources meant it remained pristine and untouched by industrial development.

During the Old Republic era, Ajan Kloss was occasionally noted on star charts as a potential waypoint for explorers venturing into the Unknown Regions, though few vessels made the journey to its location. The moon's dense jungles and lack of civilization made it an unappealing destination for colonization efforts.

Throughout the Clone Wars and the subsequent rise of the Galactic Empire, Ajan Kloss remained undisturbed. Its distance from the conflicts that engulfed the galaxy allowed the moon to maintain its pristine natural state.

During the Galactic Civil War, Ajan Kloss continued its existence in obscurity, unknown to both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance. The moon's thick canopy and remote location made it an ideal hiding place, though no faction utilized it during this period.

After the Battle of Endor and throughout the early years of the New Republic, Ajan Kloss remained an unremarkable jungle moon on the fringes of explored space, its potential as a base or refuge yet to be discovered.

Alderaan was a terrestrial planet in the Core Worlds, one of the Republic's founding members for over 25,000 years. Known for its natural beauty, peaceful philosophy, and cultural achievements, Alderaan was a center of learning and diplomacy throughout galactic history.

The planet featured diverse terrain including mountains, plains, oceans, and forests, with cities built to harmonize with the environment. The University of Alderaan was among the galaxy's most prestigious institutions, while Alderaanian artists and philosophers contributed immeasurably to galactic culture.

Alderaan maintained its commitment to peace throughout its history, refusing to keep a standing military beyond a ceremonial guard. During the Clone Wars, Viceroy Bail Organa led the planet in supporting the Republic while providing humanitarian aid across the galaxy. As Chancellor Palpatine accumulated power, Organa grew increasingly concerned about democratic erosion, working with Senators Padm Amidala and Mon Mothma to oppose the growing authoritarianism.

After Order 66 and the Empire's rise, Bail Organa publicly accepted Imperial rule to protect his people while secretly founding the Alliance to Restore the Republic. He adopted Padm's daughter Leia, raising her as Princess of Alderaan. The planet became the Rebellion's secret headquarters, with Organa using Alderaan's wealth and diplomatic connections to fund and organize resistance.

Princess Leia joined her father's cause, serving as both Imperial Senator and key Rebel leader. However, Imperial authorities grew suspicious of Alderaan's role in supporting the Rebellion.

In 0 BBY, after capturing Princess Leia with the stolen Death Star plans, Grand Moff Tarkin brought the battle station to Alderaan. To force Leia to reveal the Rebel base location, he threatened to destroy her homeworld. Despite Leia providing false information, Tarkin ordered Alderaan destroyed anyway "to demonstrate the power of this station."

The Death Star's superlaser fired, completely destroying Alderaan and killing all two billion inhabitants instantly. The planet shattered into asteroids, erasing thousands of years of culture and civilization in moments. The massive loss of life created a disturbance in the Force felt across the galaxy.

Rather than intimidating the galaxy into submission, Alderaan's destruction galvanized support for the Rebellion. "Remember Alderaan" became a rallying cry, strengthening resistance against Imperial tyranny. Shortly after, the Rebel Alliance destroyed the Death Star at the Battle of Yavin.

The asteroid field known as 'the Graveyard' became a memorial to the destroyed world. Only a few hundred thousand Alderaanians who were off-planet survived, scattered as refugees throughout the galaxy. These survivors worked to preserve their culture and ensure their homeworld's legacy endured.

Princess Leia, devastated but defiant, continued leading the Rebellion with renewed determination. After Endor, she helped establish the New Republic, working to build the democratic institutions Alderaan had championed. Though Alderaan was gone, its ideals of compassion, justice, and commitment to peace continued inspiring the galaxy, serving as both a reminder of Imperial cruelty and a symbol of resistance against tyranny.

Andalia is a star system located in the Lorelli Reach region of the Hapes Cluster, within the Inner Rim Territories. The system lies along the Lorell Route hyperlane, connecting it to the neighboring Lorell and Sennex systems.

The Hapes Cluster, including the Andalia system, remained isolated from the greater galaxy for thousands of years, protected by the dangerous Transitory Mists that surround the cluster. This isolation allowed the Hapan culture to develop independently under matriarchal rule.

During the Old Republic era, the Andalia system was part of the territory controlled by the Lorell Raiders, pirates who preyed upon passing ships until they were defeated by the Jedi. Following their defeat, the surviving pirates and their captured mates formed the basis of Hapan society, establishing the matriarchal traditions that would define the Hapes Consortium.

Throughout the millennia that followed, Andalia remained under the control of the Queen Mother and the Hapan Royal Court. The system maintained the isolationist policies that characterized the Hapes Consortium, with limited contact with the outside galaxy.

During the Clone Wars and throughout the Galactic Civil War, the Hapes Consortium maintained its traditional neutrality, and Andalia remained isolated from the conflict that engulfed much of the galaxy. The Transitory Mists continued to serve as a natural barrier, protecting the system from outside interference.

After the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic, the Hapes Consortium began to cautiously open diplomatic relations with the outside galaxy.

Annaj is a remote, fog-shrouded planet located in the Outer Rim Territories. A world perpetually covered in thick mists and atmospheric haze, Annaj's surface features varied terrain including forests, plains, and scattered settlements adapted to the planet's limited visibility conditions.

Discovered approximately three hundred years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, Annaj's strategic position made it valuable as a waypoint for vessels traveling into isolated sectors. Despite its remote location, the planet developed a modest population based on serving traders and explorers venturing into the deep Outer Rim and Wild Space.

During the Old Republic era, Annaj maintained a quiet existence as a frontier world. The planet joined the Galactic Republic but remained largely peripheral to Core Worlds politics and conflicts. Throughout the Clone Wars, Annaj's isolation spared it from direct involvement in the conflict between the Republic and the Separatists.

Following the rise of the Galactic Empire, Annaj's fate changed dramatically when Imperial strategists recognized its potential value. The planet's remote location and natural concealment provided by perpetual fog made it attractive for covert military operations.

During construction of the second Death Star above Endor, Annaj's importance increased significantly. The Empire designated the planet as a major staging area for the Imperial Navy, coordinating supply shipments and troop movements to the Endor system. The fog-covered world proved ideal for concealing the massive military buildup, with Star Destroyers and supply vessels using Annaj as a mustering point before proceeding to Endor.

Imperial forces constructed expanded military facilities on Annaj's surface and in orbit, transforming the quiet frontier world into a bustling military hub. The local population found themselves under increased Imperial oversight as garrison troops and naval personnel flooded the planet. The Empire maintained strict security protocols, restricting civilian traffic and monitoring communications to prevent information leaks to the Rebel Alliance.

Following the Battle of Endor and the destruction of the second Death Star, Annaj again played a crucial role. As news of the Emperor's death reached Imperial forces, many commanders ordered vessels to fall back to pre-designated rally points. Annaj, having served as a staging area during construction, was one such location.

Imperial forces retreated to Annaj in significant numbers, with Star Destroyers gathering at the fog-shrouded world while commanders assessed the situation. The planet became a temporary refuge for Imperial personnel evacuating from Endor and nearby sectors where Rebel forces advanced.

The concentration of Imperial assets made Annaj strategically significant immediately after Endor, though the Empire's fractured command structure meant little coordination among forces that had retreated there. Some commanders sought to regroup and continue fighting, while others questioned whether the Empire could survive.

As months passed and the full extent of the Empire's defeat became clear, Imperial forces at Annaj began to disperse. Some vessels departed to join Imperial warlords and remnant factions, while others were recalled to defend Core territories. The planet's brief moment as a major Imperial stronghold faded as the Empire's authority fragmented.

After formation of the New Republic, Annaj's status became uncertain as various factions competed for control of strategic Outer Rim positions.

Anoat is a heavily polluted industrial world located in the Anoat system of the Greater Javin region in the Outer Rim Territories. Positioned strategically between the Hoth and Bespin systems along the Ison Corridor, Anoat has long served as a waypoint for travelers navigating this remote sector of space.

The planet's surface is dominated by sprawling industrial complexes, factories, and mining operations that have transformed much of the landscape into a haze-covered wasteland. Centuries of unchecked industrialization have resulted in severe atmospheric pollution, with toxic smog blanketing many urban areas. Despite these harsh conditions, Anoat maintains a substantial population of workers, traders, and various species drawn by employment opportunities in its factories and shipyards.

Anoat's economy revolves primarily around heavy manufacturing and resource processing. The planet's industrial infrastructure produces everything from starship components to mining equipment, with goods exported throughout the Greater Javin region and beyond. However, the environmental cost of this industrial prowess has been severe, with large sections of the planet rendered nearly uninhabitable by pollution and industrial waste.

During the Old Republic era, Anoat was discovered by early explorers charting the Ison Corridor. The planet's mineral wealth and strategic location made it an attractive target for colonization, and within a few centuries, it had developed into a significant industrial center. However, the lack of environmental regulations during this period of rapid growth set the stage for the ecological degradation that would define the planet's future.

Throughout the Clone Wars, Anoat remained officially neutral, though its industrial output made it valuable to both the Republic and the Separatists.
