I'm here to help with the %1.

(email Content)Due to our close proximity to the %2 space, we are looking for volunteers help secure our borders as well as repel any the %2 incursions. We have a wide variety of tasks to assign so whatever your skills do not hesitate to sign up!
(email Appendix)You can find our contact information in your mission interface.
My job here is to help coordinate our efforts against our enemy.
If you're here, it means you have been recognised as a true friend.
There is a great need for pilots like you.
Our enemy has been a constant threat throughout our history. Many see them as a force of nature, something we have to weather and survive, but the reality is, this is a war.
We can't just throw every passing pilot at the enemy. Any potential recruits will undergo a probation period.
Each engagement needs to be a victory or they'll overrun us. I'm sure you knew that or you wouldn't be here. Let's get started.
Sorry, but this is a high-risk situation. We require pilots who have proven themselves.
There will be a wide range of tasks, from combat deployments to construction work. Depending on the situation, you will have a selection of tasks to choose from.
(unused)You will be paid as you complete your allotted tasks, with a potential bonus at the end.
(unused)As someone who's been toe to toe with the Xenon I'm sure you know what they are capable of.
(unused)The Xenon are a 'race' of intelligent, replicating machines and they have been a looming threat throughout our history.
(unused)They were originally created to help the Terrans explore the stars and terraform worlds but trying to control Artificial General Intelligence proved costly.
(unused)And now, hundreds of years later, we're still trying to clean up their mistake but we have no idea how far they have spread throughout the universe.
(unused)All we can do is hold out and prevent them from spreading any further. Every other government, allied or not, is faced with the Xenon threat. It's about the only thing we can all agree on.
(unused)We've even had temporary ceasefires with the Holy Order when faced with a Xenon attack. Quite temporary though.
Sorry. We're still reviewing your performance from the last time.
Alright. I'll have a suitable task picked out for you momentarily.
You will now find tasks related to our enemy in your mission interface.
The %2 activity has been increasing for some time now and we must be prepared for the case that we are their target.
While lacking, our intelligence network in the %2 space seems to suggest that an attack in imminent.
While we believe that the %2 are intelligent enough to learn from their actions, they continue to make the mistake of challenging us.
Our recon ships, at great risk to themselves, successfully provided vital information on the %2 activity. This gives us a major upper-hand in our operations.

The %2 seem to be becoming more bold, if they are even capable of such behaviour. After probing our defences in the previous skirmishes, they seem to think our space is an easy target. Unfortunately, they're not far wrong.
While Federation Intelligence continues to analyse recent %2 behaviour, we must make sure that our defences are prepared for the likely event of further %2 aggression.
There are a number of high-priority tasks which will be vital in securing our space.

The %2 have time and again proven to be a menace, but as we continue to learn about them, our ability to defend and fight back effectively improves. It is imperative that we hold out so that we can counter as soon as we are able.
We have a short window to shore up our defences and ready our people for the potential push from the %2. We're looking for independent contractors to help us with this.

The %2 do not seem to understand why they continue to fail when attempting to engage us in our own space. While that is not to say we have not suffered losses, we pride ourselves on our strong defences against the 'force of nature' that is the %2.
Our reconnaissance teams confirm a build up of %2 ships in their space and expect that they may soon make a move on us. While we have this respite, we will continue to prepare our defences.
We have learned much in the many years of conflict with the %2 and we must use that knowledge to continue pushing them back.
We are preparing a large-scale effort in shoring up our defences in cooperation with local corporations and neighbouring allies. Any skilled pilots are also encouraged to take part.
Given the apparent strength of the %2 forces amassing in their space, we current find ourselves at a disadvantage unless we can respond in kind and strengthen our own fleets and defences.
Our recent losses to the %2 have left us at a distinct disadvantage should they continue their push into our space. We must continue to push on with securing our space and protecting our people.

With our forces being stretched we will begin a drive to shoring up our defences with the construction of defensive structures and new ships. While this is taxing on our infrastructure, it is imperative that we don't give the %2 a free pass into our space.
We are looking for able individuals to aid our shipwrights as well as potentially invest significant time and resources into new construction projects.
While we only have a short window to shore up our defences, we expect any help in these areas will play a key part in future engagements with the %2.
The %2 do have the advantage of self-replication to help shore up their numbers, but we have shown time and time again that the %1 Navy can put up a fight, even against the odds.
Groups of %2 ships continue to mass around several entry points into our space. We don't know if they're aware that they are being monitored but it gives us a good look at their current strength.
Now is the time to make sure that our warships and static defences are ready to give the %2 a grand welcome once they decide to give us a visit.
We are looking for individuals able to provide significant time and resources in helping us complete a number of large construction projects.
Individuals with experience in station or ship construction are encouraged to help aid with the coordination of several defence projects.

If there's one thing we have in common with the %2, it's our reliance on the natural resources in our respective territories. Of course, they have the advantage that they don't need to maintain farms like we do.
One of the areas that the %2 seem drawn to are our resource fields where they often harass our mining ships. We also assume they're scouting for resources which they can use for their replication.
If we are to continue our struggle against them, as well as simply survive, we must be sure that our factories and shipyards continue to get the resources they need.

Our supply lines have previously been disrupted by %2 activity to the point that it became a substantial risk to our fighting ability. To safeguard against this, we are to focus on preparing our infrastructure for any potential economic shock the %2 may cause.

The recent %2 activity, as well as our war with the Holy Order has put a sizeable strain on our infrastructure and supply lines, leaving us with slow construction projects and the onset of rationing. As we can not allow this to continue we are requesting the willing and able pilots to help us reverse the situation.

We expect the conflict with the %2 will once again have some skirmishes occur in our territory. While we have enough measures in place to mitigate their activity, we must ere on the side of caution, especially when it comes to our supply lines.

It seems that the %2 are preparing for some raids into our space. We are confident in our defences but it is foolish to underestimate the amount of damage the %2 can cause when they run amok, especially to freighters and mining ships.

As we continue to press the %2, we must guarantee that our economy continues to function smoothly. This will include protecting our supply lines and mining areas as well as searching for any new sources of raw resources.

We have a number of tasks to both relieve economic stress on our infrastructure as well as safeguard supply lines and resource gathering areas. If you have the facilities to help, please consider signing up for assignment.
While we expect that the ever-restless %2 are preparing another offensive against us, our intelligence agencies currently lack the resources to help us prepare our defences effectively.

In recent weeks we have been working with nought but rumour as we try to get on top of the %2's activities and intentions. While we know a new offensive is coming, details such as ship numbers and location remain lacking.

Our best people have been hard at work to come up with ways to help us improve the our intel and give us a helping hand in tracking the %2. Any solid information will give us a much higher chance to counter further aggression.

Over the many years of attempting to better understand the %2, we have taken many risks such as going deep into their space or salvaging their wreckage. Any interaction with %2, even those rendered inert, is thwart with danger.

We have a number of tasks available, some of which may involve spending time in %2 territory or even interacting with the %2 themselves. As such, these tasks are designated heavy risk. We require pilots confident enough to go behind enemy lines and skilled enough to come back safely.

A number of intel tasks are available. That said, given the dangers that operations in %2 space pose, we are only looking for pilots who are confident in their ability to work behind enemy lines as well as get back in one piece.
Despite having favourable outcomes in our recent engagements with the %2, we can't overlook that our intelligence agencies are often working with outdated information.
If we want to continue holding the %2 back the way we have been we must ensure that our intelligence is both up to date and reliable.
We have several options available to us to improve our intel to allow us to formulate better strategies against the %2.
We are looking for trusted and skilled individuals to perform a number of these tasks, helping us maintain the upper hand.
The %2 have been pressing us quite hard recently, but it seems that we have an opening to deal them a blow. Any distraction which pulls them away from our space will give us a much welcome reprieve.

With the %2 being a constant sight for such a long period of time, it has felt that we were on the back foot. However, our intelligence teams have found several targets worth engaging in the hope that it will have the %2 pull back somewhat.
We will take any opportunity to repair our defences and redeploy our forces.

We would be fools to think we can predict what the %2 will do, but we know that if we hit them hard enough, they will have no choice but to send at least a large chunk of their forces back home. We're looking for level-headed and skilled pilots, capable of doing the job and getting home safely.

They may have forced our hand but the %2 are just as vulnerable to hit-and-run tactics as anyone else. As long as those involved come back safe, we believe this is worth the effort. Even if it doesn't have the desired effect, it will at least give the %2 something to waste CPU cycles on.

We've managed to score some major victories against the %2 as of late, but it certainly isn't a time to let up. While we expect a counter attack from them any time, we believe we can buy more time to organise our defences by striking sensitive targets.

We have known for some time that the %2 might come for us again, as they have many times already. Our tactical teams are forever working to devise new ways to have the %2 go in circles and this may just get their attention.
Any additional time we can get will be spent on better preparing for the next push against them as well as strengthening our current positions.
We're looking for a select number of skilled and experienced pilots who are confident in their ability to get behind enemy lines, cause some havoc and come back safely.

Things are looking rather dire. One thing these machines have over us is the fact that they feel neither fear nor exhaustion. They are just launching one attack after the other, without respite. We need time to pull ourselves together, and the best way to do that is to disrupt their operations enough to divert their focus.

Our supplies are steadily diminishing. We need to turn this war around and finally gain some ground on %2 Empire. Not many things will actually hurt them, but if we managed to destroy one of their stations, we might be able to turn the tide.
We can only withstand their relentless invasion for so long. That is why we are looking for someone to aid us with this crucial operation.
They might have us on the ropes at the moment, but blowing up one of their stations will give us some air to breathe. Make no mistake, though, this will be a hard battle.
If we manage to cut a swathe through their front line, we can gain a foothold in their sector and turn this war around. To pull this off, we need to weaken their control by targeting their stations.

When you fight these rigid machines, it is important to make an effort to act unpredictably, even erratic, sometimes. It will take them considerable time to formulate an adequate response. This is why command has decided to strike the enemy where they least expect it.
We have made considerable progress on the %2 front. Enough that we can push into their territory, and deliver a devastating blow. These circuit boards won't know what hit them!
If we manage to destroy one of their stations we could disrupt production, and possibly even severely weaken The %2 control over the sector. It is a vitally important task.
Because of this operation's importance, we decided to turn to a powerful ally such as yourself, and are willing to pay handsomely. If you can pull this off, that is.

page.title: war subs text backup
page.t: Throughout this conflict, the %2 have again proven to be a formidable force, making advances on several fronts. Along with our allies, we have held them back in several vital areas but we have lost ground.
We have commenced operations to reclaim our territories but we expect this will be a long and drawn out effort.

We are calling on all willing and able pilots to help us drive the %2 out of our space. Tasks will involve backing up combat units as well as defending critical areas as we continue to regain a foothold.
Thanks to the efforts of the Rebel Alliance Navy, our allies and volunteers such as yourself, we are currently in a prime position to deal a heavy blow to the %2.

Their constant aggression has thinned out their forces and they find themselves on the back foot. While we can't expect to put an end to the %2 once and for all, we can at least push them back far enough to secure our space.

We are looking for driven and skilled pilots willing to brave The %2 space and help with our efforts. Jobs will include linking with combat wings to both attack their positions as well as defend ours.

While there are others working on building larger military installations to help in our defence, many crucial areas still lack basic defences such as laser towers. This is something we want to resolve as quickly as possible.

The %2 are a threat to all other races, and as such, we must cooperate where we can. There is a neighbouring sector with an entry point for the %2 where we feel it imperative that defences improve. We require a number of mines to be placed in this strategic location.

As you may well know, we share a border with the %2, although it's unclear if they even conceive borders. Either way, it is an incredibly important strategic location. We feel that sector security will be improved should we deploy a number of mines in that area.

We expect one of the reasons for the %2 to intrude in our territory is to take advantage of our resource rich regions. To help secure these areas, we would like you to deploy a number of laser towers at strategic points which are critical to our economy.

At the request of our intelligence division, we require a single satellite to be placed in a vital area. We not only want to gain sensor data for that region, we also want to bait the %2 into some response. Anything we can do to dictate their movements or reveal their strength will aid us when we have to make a move ourselves.

Though our main priority in this area is to keep an eye on the movements of the %2, a sensor grid is necessary to track any potential threats to our space. We are looking for you to acquire satellites and fill the holes in that net.\n$REQUIREMENTS$
While they may not last long, we would like the opportunity to deploy satellites and build a better picture of The %2 space and their ship movements.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Several of our ships are in need of minor repairs and to help take the strain off of our shipyards, we are looking to make as many in-space repairs as possible. As the crew continues to repair the internal systems, we require additional help for the hull and external sub-systems.

A number of specialists on The %2 behaviour and historical impact are to be transported to strategic locations to aid those preparing our defences. We require a number of pilots to come forward to provide safe and swift transport for these clients.

We are requesting a new military installation to be built in a strategic location to help us defend against any future aggression from the %2. We will require the facility to fit the following specifications.

In order to plan future operations against the %2, we would like to gauge what resources they have available to them in their space. Attempt to find high yield regions of the following resource: $WARENAMES$

A number of scientists from several races have banded together to launch an independent expedition into The %2 space. Not only is this a completely reckless endeavour, it hands the %2 a high-spec science ship full of valuable data right onto their lap. We need this ship stopped, preferably without bloodshed. A boarding operation is authorised.
As we push to take control of $SECTOR$, we require support for our combat units in whatever way possible.

One thing we believe gives us an edge on the %2 is that no two people are the same. Given enough discipline, any two pilots can work together and become a capable team, even in the heat of battle. This gives us a very fluid presence on the battlefield which we don't think the %2 can handle that well.
We are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\) to undergo provisional tests for our rapid-response program.
$DESTINATION$
$SKILLS$

To make sure that our military installations are performing at peak efficiency during the war against the %2, we are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ engineer\(s\) to be brought to one of our stations.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

You cannot win a war without a fleet. Our shipyards are working at full capacity, but in order to bolster our numbers, we require the support of independent suppliers. To help in the war-effort, please bring the following ships to $SECTOR$ :\n$FLEET$

There have been concerns from several station managers that the increased The %2 activity will have a heavy impact on their supply lines. As the state of the local economy has a direct impact on our ability to construct defences we have agreed to assign a number of agents to help them stockpile resources.\n\nThe station related to this task requests that their resource levels are raised above: $STORAGEPERCENT$%

A number of The %2 ships of a certain spec have been causing us a lot of trouble recently. While any The %2 taken out is a good thing, we are keen to take these specific ships out of the picture as soon as possible. You will need to keep an eye out for The %2 with the following specification: $SHIP$

In the past, we have managed to perform detailed scans on a number of The %2. To progress in our research, we require a follow up scan on a specific The %2 to better understand their development over time.\n\nTarget reveal percentage: $PERCENT$

One of our best chances to deal a significant blow to the %2 is by disrupting their infrastructure. We're not too sure how much of it is involved in their ability to self-replicate, but they wouldn't have stations if they weren't important. We need one of these such stations scanned.\n\nTarget reveal percentage: $PERCENT$
We are interested in getting more detailed information on The %2 station modules to help us when planning future operation in The %2 space.\n\nWe need the following module scanned: $MODULE$

There have been reports of The %2 collecting salvage after battles, which is not unheard of. Some reports however mention them being interested in some items we would not have expected. To give these sightings more merit, we would like to catch a The %2 craft carrying some of these items. Once confirmed, we'll put additional effort into theorising what the %2 could be using these items for.\n\nFind the %2 ship containing: $WARE$
We have lost track of a The %2 ship of interest and need someone to help track it down. The ship in question has ID code $IDCODE$

Federation Intelligence assigned our task force to map out crucial targets in the %2 energy networks. Such groundwork could enable the Rebel Alliance to cripple multiple The %2 facilities as a whole. To complete our survey we request additional scans of The %2 ships transporting Energy Cells.

Even the %2 rely on basic resources to build their infrastructure. In an attempt to understand, predict and ultimately control their territorial behaviour through deterrents, our The %2 specialists from Sandwell request scans of The %2 ships transporting Ore.

While industrial espionage allows us to quickly catch up on any technological progress in the Gate network, the undeciphered The %2 communication protocols prevent us from gathering this kind of intelligence. However, being close to The %2 space grants us the unique opportunity to learn about their advances in economic organisation. To achieve this, our The %2 specialists request scans of The %2 ships transporting Silicon.

(Mines)We are preparing a foray into The %2 space in a big way, but our scouts have spotted a cluster of mines. At best, these explosives could slow down our advance, and at worst they could be a real danger to our fleet. If you cleared the way, you might save a lot of lives.

(Mines)On our last hit and run operation targeting a station in The %2 space, one of our squads maneuvered themselves into a minefield. We lost contact almost immediately, so it is safe to say that unfortunately, they won't be returning. Help us destroy The %2 mines to make sure something like this does not happen again.

Our analysts have identified a station that is crucial to the %2. We need to act decisively and with full force to take it apart. This mission is of extreme importance, and you should expect to be met with considerable resistance.

Command is awaiting a big shipment of weapons parts and other various resources that are crucial for mounting an effective offensive. We are playing for time right now. If it weren't for that delayed shipment, we'd be launching an attack already, but that's the situation we have to deal with. Nothing we can do. We want you to prepare that offensive by going after our future target's defensive systems and disabling certain turrets of key importance.

Station: $STATION$
Amount of turrets to destroy: $TURRETS$
Always spawn mission NPC handler at stations
We will assign targets to you when your targeting computer is free. Engagements against factions that are outside the scope of our mission will be ignored.
To complete the mission, ensure that %s(ship) docks, exits the sector, or finds no enemies within radar range.
Engagements against factions that are outside the scope of our mission will be ignored.
You will be rewarded for %s(ship) surviving the attack, adjusted by their enemy numbers, and for enemies that your ships engage.
Failure conditions are: %1(ship) is left with no escort for more than 5 minutes; or %1(ship) is detroyed.
%s escaped from their attackers before you had a chance to engage.
%s(ship) had no escort for more than 5 minutes.
We will assign targets to you when your targeting computer is free. Engagements against factions that are outside the scope of our mission will be ignored.
To complete the mission, ensure that %s(ship) completes all their trade orders. New trade orders that they receive during the mission may extend the mission duration.
The mission will end early when %s(ship) is left with no escort for more than 5 minutes.

You will be rewarded for each trade they complete, adjusted by the sectors they traversed, the amount of time that your ships were in escort \(while within 100km\), and for enemies that your ships engage.
Failure condition is: when %s(ship) fail to complete any trade.
Current trade mission: Sell %1(wares) to %2(trading partner).
Current trade mission: Buy %1(wares) from %2(trading partner).
Current mining mission: Deliver %1(wares) to %2(trading partner).
%1(mission name): trades completed: %2(number), sectors traversed: %3(number), time in escort: %4 / %5 \(%6%%(time in escort in perc)\).
\(Note that %s(ship) can travel up to %s(speed) m/s.\)
(description)Support %1(ship) on their raid against enemy targets in %2(sector name) for at least 20 minutes.
(description)Support %1(ship) on their patrol of %2(sector name) for at least 20 minutes.

We will assign targets to you when your targeting computer is free. These are optional targets and you are allowed to ignore them or engage other targets on your own. However, except for attacks against criminals, engagements against factions that we have not targeted will be ignored.

The mission completes when %s(ship) completes their orders or when no enemy targets are found after 20 minutes. New combat orders that they receive during the mission may extend the mission. Escort and kill rewards continue to accumulate past 20 minutes. You can request an early release from the mission.
The mission completes when %s(ship) exits the sector.
The mission will end early when %s(ship) completes their mission.
You will be rewarded for enemies that your ships engage plus a bonus if %s(ship) survives.
The mission will end early if you have no ships in the mission sector for more than 5 minutes.
Your priority is to patrol the sector - whether with the mission guidance or on your own.
%s completed their mission early \(before you received the briefing and start your escort mission\).
%1(sector name) is the home of %2(other faction).
%1(sector name) is the territory of %2(other faction).
(enroute)We are currently in %1(current sector) and enroute to %2(target sector).
We are in a fleet with: %s(L or XL ship list) and our support ships.
Intelligence reports these enemy ships in our sector: %s(L or XL ship list) and their support ships.
(mission notification)Update: Continue patrol or request a release.
(mission description)Update: Your support duties are complete but there are more enemy targets in the sector. Continue your patrol and engage enemy targets. Or request a release from the mission.
(mission notification)Update: Your support duties are complete.
%1(number) killed / %2(total) x %3(enemy macro): \033#FF00FF00#your kills: %4(number), your damage: %5(number)\033X / %6(total hull): %7(reward).
To complete the mission, ensure that %s(ship) is destroyed.
Note that %s(faction) will not retaliate against your attacks on %s(ship).
You will be rewarded %s(reward for kills of target) and, based on the amount of damage you inflict on %s(ship), about %s(reward for target).
%s(ship) was last reported at %s(position) in %s(sector) %s(time) ago. We will update you of new reports.
(Unacceptable mission reason 1)You are only allowed %s(counter) missions an hour: %s(time) min left.
(Unacceptable mission reason 2)You already have a mission on this target.
(Unacceptable mission reason 3)You are only allowed %s(counter) missions an hour.
Download the reports from this mission
You contributed no damage to the destruction of %s(ship).
You failed to confirm the identity of %s(ship).
(description)Rescue civilians from $STATION$ that is currently under attack by $ENEMY_FACTION$.

But we will assign targets to you when your targeting computer is free. These are optional targets and you are allowed to ignore them or engage other targets on your own. However, except for attacks against criminals, engagements against factions that we have not targeted will be ignored.
The mission ends when $STATION$ is destroyed or when our enemies have been driven away.
You will be rewarded for civilians that you rescue and enemies that your ships engage.
Failure condition is when no civilians are rescued.
Your priority is to rescue civilians from $STATION$.
No civilians were rescued and no enemies were engaged.
Enemies that are attacking us are: %s(L or XL ship list) and their support ships.

Activity points limiter to balance score progression between different Professions. Limits the same action performed within this time to 1 count. E.g. Without this limit, mine disposal per mine can progress Saboteur Profession faster than any activites available to Traders.

The data will be saved, restored or reset when you return to the game world.

page.title: Reactive Factions and
page.t: You are considered a nameless privateer, not noticed by anyone, and your actions don't matter on the galactic scene.
You are now considered an equal to a small private company or a mercenary band. Government representatives may start to take notice of your actions.
You are now considered as an organisation with limited influence, some of your positive deals with a faction may make their enemies a bit worried.
Your influence on galaxy arena grows and major factions start to pay close attention to your deals with their enemies.
You are acknowledged as powerful player in the galactic arena. Pay attention to your actions as not everyone will like you befriending their enemies.
Major factions now consider you to be equal to them. Your positive deals with their enemies can lead to noticeable consequences.

Dear Galactic Citizen!

The Coruscant Financial Bureau is a non-profit establishment that provides ratings of various organisations and corporations to the galactic community with the goal to improve cooperation and coordination between galactic governments and other entities. 
With recently acquired assets, you are now a subject for registration within Coruscant Financial Bureau. All documentation will be generated automatically and will be kept up to date with your future endeavors. Soon you will get a notification on the first assessment of your assets, don't miss it!

Depending on your CFB rating, you may be viewed differently by factions, so be aware of your current rating, which can be one of the following:

Privateer - if less than 150 mil. assets cost \(no rep. penalty\)
Private Company - at 150 mil. total assets cost \(10% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Organization - at 300 mil. total assets cost \(20% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Corporation - at 600 mil. total assets cost \(50% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Major Faction - at 1 billion total assets cost \(80% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)
Empire - at 1.5 billion total assets cost \(120% as rep. penalty with enemies from positive rep. gain\)

The rules for calculations are following:
 - Assets cheaper than 50k Cr are ignored
 - Traders, miners and Auxiliary ships are counted as 50% of their credit cost
 - Production Station Modules are counted as 80% of their credit cost
 - Non-Production Station Modules are counted as 35% of their credit cost
 - Shipyard and Wharf Modules are counted as 70% of their credit cost
 - All other assets are counted as 100% of their credit cost
Check logbook entry for more details.
Please be informed that after evaluation of your current assets Coruscant Financial Bureau have assigned your organisation the following rating:
Your total assets cost estimated at:

page.title: Voice Overs, not for plots
page.t: We would like to remind all visitors that any cargo left unattended may be jettisoned without notice.
Plasma purge in effect, remain clear of vents.
Visitors are required to register at station security.

page.title: Texts for big plots, no character/VOs
page.t:
Sir,
Our sensors have picked up a strange repeating signal that we cannot identify in sector $SECTOR$ approximately 300km to the $COORDS$ from the sector center, it seems to be some kind of a wreck.
It is transimitting an invitation specifically for you to come to it and it ignores all our attemts to communicate. 
Seems it waits for you to come in person.
Sith Holocron Beta has been transported to you via unknown means.
Sith Holocron Alpha has been transported to you via unknown means.

Sir,
While Investigating the premises of our new Research Facility, we found an old holocron that may be of interest to you.

-Sith Holocron Gamma has been added to your inventory.

Worst has come to worst in the Outer Rim. While exploring abandoned star systems, $PLAYERFACTION$ discovered a disabled hyperspace beacon leading to the ancient capitol of the Sith Empire and reactivated it.

Long thought dead, the Sith have survived in secret, gathering their strength, and have once again declared war on the galaxy. $PLAYERFACTION$, worryingly, has declared an alliance with them.

While the governments of the galaxy have broadcast their war response to the declaration by the Sith Empire and $PLAYERFACTION$, only time will tell if they will unify against this ancient threat, or if old divisions and petty squabbles spell their end.

Shadows rise again in the Outer Rim. While exploring abandoned star systems, $PLAYERFACTION$ discovered a disabled hyperspace beacon in the Korriban system.

Certain that it leads to a revived Sith Empire, $PLAYERFACTION$ has put pressure on various galactic governments to reactivate the beacon and help them eradicate this ancient threat.

Only time will tell if the galaxy will be able to unite against the Sith, or if a galaxy at war will be unable to resolve their conflicts to face a greater foe.

Deliver Holocrons to Sith and join them in conquering the galaxy. This will open the hyperlane to Sith territory and most factions will be aware of your actions, droping your reputation with them. Sith will share their technology with you.
Deliver Holocrons to Sith and join them in conquering the galaxy.
Open the hyperlane to Sith territory and join them.
You are now part of the Sith.

Notify other factions about Sith threat. This will force them to open the hyperlane to Sith territory which can lead to major consequences. The Sith will also be unavailable for diplomatic inteference.
Notify other factions about Sith threat.
Open the hyperlane to Sith territory and confront them.
Major factions will enter the war with Sith.

page.title: Plot character lines/VOs
page.t: Greetings, Mandalorian, your chance for redemption has arrived. Your clan was an outcast for long enough; Death Watch is calling. Prove your loyalty, capture and deliver enemy ships to us. This mission is your path back to honour; may the beskar protect you.
Mandalorian, ships were transferred, mission was completed. We welcome you. This is the way.
So be it, the galaxy will burn.

To anyone who can hear! This is captain Reed of New Republic, we identified Sith vessels in Corbos system. I repeat, Sith vessels! I urge you to relay this information to your command and government, I will include their ship's signature data in the transmission. We will try to hold them here. Calling for any available reinforcements!

This is captain none of your business of the Black Sun speaking. Too bad, we seem to be the only ones who received your transmission. Still, Sith are bad for business. We will inform the others, but dont expect any reinforcements, they are bad for business too. Black Sun out.

page.title: Timeline
page.t:
As planned by Darth Sidious, the Trade Federation blockades Naboo in protest of the Senate's decision to tax their much-used Free Trade Zones, escalating the trade disputes; Supreme Chancellor Finis Valorum secretly dispatches Qui-Gon Jinn and Obi-Wan Kenobi to serve as the ambassadors for scheduled negotiations with the Federation in hopes of resolving the Naboo Crisis.
Invasion of Naboo; Darth Sidious further manipulates the Trade Federation leadership into instigating a peace crisis for the Republic with the deployment of military forces for the occupation of the harmonious world of Naboo.
Jedi Master Sifo-Dyas foresees an upcoming full-scale conflict, but is accused of war-mongering and removed from the Jedi Council. He secretly commissions the Kaminoans of the distant planet Kamino to grow a clone army for the Republic.
Padm Amidala steps down following two two-year terms as Queen of Naboo. Rillata defeats Jamillia in her campaign to succeed Amidala, though Jamillia later reigns for four years before being succeeded by Neeyutnee during the Clone Wars.

Plot to assassinate Senator Amidala; Separatist leaders hope to silence the senator from Naboo, who opposes the Military Creation Act. Anakin Skywalker is charged with the protection of Senator Padm Amidala, and they covertly travel to her homeworld while Obi-Wan Kenobi searches for the assassin. As they spend more time together, the two fall in love.
Obi-Wan Kenobi is captured on Geonosis whilst reporting his findings of the Trade Federation presence and the Separatists' battle droid production to Jedi Councillors Yoda and Mace Windu. Anakin Skywalker and Padm Amidala attempt to rescue Kenobi, but are captured as well. The three are set to be executed after their refusal to join the Sith and surrender to Poggle and the Separatists, but the execution is interrupted by a Jedi strike force led by Mace Windu, and prevented entirely by the timely arrival of the Grand Army of the Republic, led by Yoda.

The Clone Wars begin with the First Battle of Geonosis; end of the millennium-long Great Peace.
Most of the Jedi strike team are killed in their attempt to rescue Obi-Wan Kenobi, Anakin Skywalker, and Padm Amidala from execution.
The Grand Army of the Republic engages Separatist forces on Geonosis, grounding many enemy vessels and thus most of their forces. However, the attack of the clones failed to prevent the escape of the Separatist Council.
With their victory on Geonosis, the Republic occupies the world, though they find that they could not afford to maintain the occupation. The planet is retaken by Separatist forces within a year and Archduke Poggle the Lesser quickly restarts his droid foundries.

The Battle of Coruscant occurs. General Grievous storms the Galactic City and kidnaps Chancellor Palpatine, cutting through security forces and Jedi such as Roron Corobb in doing so. Republic forces led by Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker are recalled from the Outer Rim Sieges to Coruscant to protect the Chancellor. They succeed in their mission, and Count Dooku is executed by Anakin Skywalker at the order of Chancellor Palpatine.
Luke and Leia Skywalker are born to Padm Amidala on Polis Massa. Amidala dies after childbirth due to heartbreak at her lover's fall to the dark side, though she remains adamant that there is still good in her husband. In order to protect the Skywalker twins from the Sith, Obi-Wan Kenobi leaves Luke with Anakin's stepbrother Owen Lars on Tatooine while Bail Organa adopts Leia into the Alderaanian royal house.
Senators concerned with the Chancellor's growing powers join the Delegation of 2,000 and take part in the Cantham House meetings hosted by Senator Bail Organa. Key figures at Cantham House include Padm Amidala and Mon Mothma, who sign the Petition of 2,000 requesting Chancellor Palpatine's relinquishment of his emergency powers.
Anakin Skywalker is anointed Darth Vader, Dark Lord of the Sith.
Per the Supreme Chancellor's command, Order 66 is executed by clones throughout the galaxy, spelling the end of nearly all Jedi.
The Galactic Empire is the dominant force in the Galaxy for next 19 years.

Following the disastrous Battle of Scarif, in which the Rebel Alliance recovered the secret plans for the Galactic Empire's dreaded Death Star battlestation, Princess Leia flees the Empire in search of Jedi Master Obi-Wan Kenobi, who has lived in hiding since the rise of the Empire. Though she is captured above Tatooine, her droids C-3PO and R2-D2 escape with the Death Star plans.
The two droids eventually came to meet Luke Skywalker, who helps them find Kenobi, though Luke's aunt and uncle are later murdered by Imperial stormtroopers. Luke, Kenobi, and the droids hire the smugglers Han Solo and Chewbacca to transport them to Alderaan, only to find the peaceful world destroyed by the Death Star. After the smugglers' ship, the Millennium Falcon, is captured by the Death Star's tractor beams, its crew and passengers discover Princess Leia imprisoned aboard. Though they rescued her, Obi-Wan Kenobi is slain in a duel with Darth Vader. The Millennium Falcon escapes and travels to Yavin IV, but is tracked by the Empire.
$DESTINATION$
The Rebel Alliance sends a desperate strike force to exploit the Death Star's weakness, and whilst many Rebel pilots are lost, Luke Skywalker fires the critical shot that ultimately destroys the Imperial battlestation.

This is the start date of the Galactic Empire's decline.
Galaxy wide insurgency erupts against the Empire.

Echo Base is established inside a mountain on Hoth by the Rebel Alliance. The Rebel Alliance launch the Mid Rim Offensive campaign.\nThe Battle of Hoth occurs. The Alliance suffers a costly blow when the Empire attacks Echo Base, although Carlist Rieekan's evacuation order helps Rebels escape in time to avoid a complete catastrophe.\n

The Battle of Endor, also known as the assault on the second Death Star, was a major and decisive battle of the Galactic Civil War, one in which the Alliance to Restore the Republic shattered the rule of the Galactic Empire and saw the destruction of the DS-2 Death Star II Mobile Battle Station and the deaths of Darth Sidious and Darth Vader.\nThe triumph of the Alliance over the Empire, and the void left in the wake of the Emperor's demise, gave the Alliance the opportunity to found the New Republic, which ultimately prevailed over the Empire in the Battle of Jakku one year later.

Celebrations of the Empire's fall at Endor take place throughout the galaxy, including bonfires in Bright Tree Village, gatherings on Cloud City, a rally on Naboo, and parades on Tatooine. However, celebrations on Coruscant lead to a crackdown at Monument Plaza, sparking the Coruscant Civil War.

page.title: Interface
page.t: Manage your influence within the galaxy by recruiting and directing Agents. Deploy them to negotiate agreements, gather intelligence, spy on enemies and allies, or stir up tensions between factions.

Oversee emerging galactic affairs and delegate agents to strategically influence their outcomes, thereby altering the balance of power within the galaxy. Forge new alliances or dismantle existing ones, while adapting to the resulting consequences.

page.title: Mission Argon/Terran NPC Female 22 / Segaris diplomat
page.t: (Accepting invitation)Our people are honoured by your invitation. I will be aboard your station shortly.
(Diplomat Arrival Confirmation)I've made it to your embassy.
(Player deteriorates relations, diplomat leaves)We cannot work alongside someone who treats us so poorly.
(Player requests military support)We'll see what sort of military support we can muster.
(Faction military support has ended)While aiding you in combat has been a welcome diversion, our forces need to get back to what really matters...

page.title: Diplomacy actions
page.t: The agent infiltrates a shipyard and attempts to steal blueprints of capital ships. With the aid of an espionage droid, the agent has a good chance of obtaining even heavily encrypted blueprints, though some element of chance remains. {20235,20322}

The agent infiltrates a wharf and attempts to steal blueprints of small and medium ships. With the aid of an espionage droid, the agent has a good chance of obtaining even heavily encrypted blueprints, though some element of chance remains. {20235,20322}

The agent infiltrates a faction's headquarters and attempts to steal blueprints of station modules. With the aid of an espionage droid, the agent has a good chance of obtaining even heavily encrypted blueprints, though some element of chance remains. {20235,20322}

The agent infiltrates an equipment dock and attempts to steal blueprints of the equipment on offer. With the aid of an espionage droid, the agent has a good chance of obtaining even heavily encrypted blueprints, though some element of chance remains. {20235,20322}

page.title: Rescue Ship
page.t: One of our trading pilots thought they could make it through a mine field that has been placed on one of our trade routes. It took them all of a minute to realise that they were stuck, and now we're running behind schedule. If you can help us by clearing the minefield around the ship, there's still enough time to salvage the contract before one of our competitors swoops in to steal it from us.

During a high-speed escape from their former 'friends', a crew of pirate defectors managed to maroon themselves in a cluster of their own mines nearby. We have offered them safe conduct in return for inside information on pirate operations, but this deal means nothing as long as they are unable to leave the danger zone. If you are confident in your ability to handle tracker mines, please find a way to remove them without damaging the ship.

We are continuously updating our security protocols and defensive installations to stay ahead in the galactic arms race. Due to their volatile and fickle nature, tracker mines have often caused us problems in this regard. Last time, we hired an especially eager contractor, who insisted on a 'hands on' approach. Halfway through the process, they realised their mistake and, in trying to revert the software update, accidentally reset the mines' friend-or-foe recognition. We are legally obligated to remove the malfunctioning mines and would like to outsource this task to pilots of all skill levels. If you are up for it, please also make sure not to damage our former contractor's ship, as his demise would unnecessarily strain our insurance.

One of our military scientists was running tests on new, experimental smart mine software - they had to deploy the mines in order to complete the tests thoroughly. Unbeknownst to them, there was a bug in the software that means every time the scientist attempts to move their vessel, the mines activate and track them. They've had to shut down all engines and thrusters to remain safe. Please detonate the mines so that the scientist, key to our future research, might be rescued.

Our reconnaissance found an inactive minefield which has been identified as a completely unknown technology. A military scientist, eager to research this technology, has been deployed to examine the mines and extract relevant hardware. Unfortunately in his endeavours he triggered some safeguard within the mines and activated the whole field. It's a miracle that they didn't blow him up right away, but now he is stuck and, from his position, is unable to safely attempt an escape. To return the scientist, his research and the hardware he was able to extract, we need someone to disarm the mines without harming the ship and its crew.

One of our minefields has been taken over by an unknown party. The hacked mines behave as usual, until they identify a ship they are supposed to let through. The malware then primes the mines trapping the ship inside. Another ship with transit clearance got trapped inside one of our minefields. We need someone to free the victim and their ship unharmed.

page.title: Find Object
page.t: I was attacked by some pirates on my last trading run. I was able to escape, just, but my ship was destroyed and most of my inventory along with it. While I look for a new ship, I'd like someone to go out and see whether anything survived the attack, and bring it back to me if it has.

page.title: Escort Ship
page.t: (Description)One of our traders has been tasked with supplying a station with critical wares. Unfortunately, some people do not want that trade run to succeed, and will do everything in their power to stop it dead in its tracks. If you accompany our trader and make sure it arrives at its destination, we will reward you with a slice of the profits.

(Description)It took considerable effort, but we were finally able to get two opposing parties to sit down to negotiations aimed at resolving their conflict. Unfortunately, a third party has become aware of our plans, and is trying very hard to make sure these talks never take place. One of the delegations involved in these talks was attacked, and now their main dignitary is stranded on one of our stations. If you can ensure that his ship makes it to the talks, you will be paid handsomely.

(Description)We are in dire need of mined materials to keep our economy going. Unfortunately, our mining ships have recently been coming under attack by Yuuzhan Vong forces. It seems that they are somehow drawn to the ore. We need you to accompany our mining ship and make sure that it can deliver its wares unharmed.

(Description)Our scouts have reported a worrying increase in Yuuzhan Vong activity close to our preferred asteroid fields. We are worried that our mining activity has made us a target of Vong raids. We would be willing to pay a significant amount if you can guarantee our mining ship makes its way out of those asteroids and safely back to our station.

page.title: DeadAir Script T Files FOR SW
page.descr: names used in DeadAir Scripts in SW
page.t: Changes whether the Dynamic News script will continue to run.
Changes whether Dynamic News will send notifications on monitored events.
Changes whether Dynamic News will write to the logbook on monitored events.
Changes whether Dynamic News will store recent news events.
Changes the minimum time between the script checking for any new reports. This will change the time between checks for groups of reports that will be output in regular intervals.
Changes whether debug entries in the code will output text or files. Has no effect if game is not run in the appropriate debug mode.
Restricts certain news entries if the faction is not known to player.
%1 extending station %2 \(%3\) with additional %4 modules in %5.
